updates.update_content:
Greetings all!

I'm pleased to announce that nearly all of the pledge rewards have now been despatched*! Delivery over Christmas is likely to be a little sluggish, but hopefully you'll be receiving your goodies soon if you haven't already :)

Evening all!
As you may have already seen, I've just sent out all the surveys. They are very quick and easy as I mainly just need your address.
If you would like to add any extras that you missed during the campaign, want to change anything, or are placing an order through the store for other stuff and would like me to combine them then please just let me know in the 'comments' question.
We are planning to get started on packing next weekend, so the earlier you can fill in your survey the better!
Thank you all for backing! It's been another fun campaign, even if I am itching to run the full Kedashi campaign now (with proper stretch goals and extra craziness)... Roll on spring 2021!

We are rapidly approaching the final 24 hours of the campaign! 
It's been short and sweet and very different to prior campaigns, but I hope you've enjoyed it. I was very pleasantly surprised by the support you guys have shown once again and I hope you'll have fun testing out these new models.

I've spent a couple of updates rambling on about the Heavy KalMalog, but poor old Alaim and the Skerrat Broodmother haven't had much attention yet!

updates.update_userinfo: Developing rules for the Heavy KalMalog
updates.update_content:
It's Friday night after a long week, so now seems like a perfect time to talk about Rules development...
I've already told you all about the creation of the Heavy KalMalog, but I didn't include the final stages of the process; designing the rules so you can use this poor little fella to unleash hell on your opponents.
Whenever I'm designing rules I start by trying to think what I want the model to do and where it fits in the game. For some models this is easy (grishak - charge quickly and eat things), others are more tricky (how should the random engineers work?), but the key detail is trying to work out that essence.

These short campaigns always fly by so quickly!
I've been a bit slack coming up with stretch goals this time as I want to make sure that whatever I add doesn't lead to any delays! I am talking to the caster though, so maybe tomorrow.
Instead, I'm start with a silly little extra option: Festive gift wrapping.

Thanks everybody for a great first day of the campaign! We are funded and I've been warning John (my caster) that he's going to be busy.

It seems like a good time to tell you a little about John and about how the Heavy KalMalog came to life... John is a good friend and generally talented chap who runs Gydran Miniatures. He's responsible for doing all the casting this time around, but also takes a lot of the credit for the Heavy KalMalog.

Thanks everybody for getting this going so fast! I’m always nervous when starting a new campaign, so genuinely appreciate the support.
This will be a simple campaign (I’m aware of how fast Christmas is approaching and I want to make that deadline!), but I’ve got a few little ideas in the works to keep things interesting...
Do feel free to make suggestions though!

After having sold more that 4 million copies of the base game and over 8 million copies including DLCs, the time has come for Darkest Dungeon to move from the screens to your table. Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game is a fully cooperative dungeon crawler game in which players take on the role of adventurers. Although brave and determined, adventurers are only human! They are prone to the madness and pain the twisted dwellers of the dungeons will inflict upon them. Death can occur, but is not the worst fate: heroes can be driven mad and beyond help!
Please note minis come unpainted.
The game is played in campaigns of 11 missions. To reach the Darkest Dungeon itself, players will undertake 3 missions per threat level and vanquish the boss. Then, they will be strong enough to face the horrors of the Darkest Dungeon! They may emerge victorious... if they dispatch the source of evil that plagues the land.
Please note minis come unpainted.
For each hero, select 3 skills out of 7 before heading into your mission (and level the heroes up to gain access to more skills). In each room, pick the most suitable stance to best resolve the conflict! Then, on each turn, a player chooses two of the available actions of moving, interacting with the environment, changing their stance or using a skill (if eligible for their current stance). Triumph over encounters, resist rampant madness and emerge victorious before throwing yourself into another battle. Between missions, spend your time in the hamlet, visiting various buildings to find relief from the physical and mental trauma you’ve just endured. Restore the hamlet to its former glory and it will reward you and help you to fulfill the ultimate goal.
RPG-like heroes  – A robust level up system with a ton of customization for unique playable characters.
Stressful Affliction System – Heroes' personalities are paramount! Contend with paranoia, abusiveness, fear, irrationality, and a host of gameplay-meaningful quirks.
Town meta-game – Help your Hamlet growth, and tend to your heroes’ wounds, both corporeal and cerebral.
Loot! Gold, consumable supplies, and mystical trinkets.
Classic roguelike features  transferred to your table, including permadeath & procedural dungeons.
High Replay-ability – One tile, infinite dungeons.
Tough tactical choices - Light tracking, perma death… The combat system pits you against a host of diabolical monsters.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
General

This is our tenth Kickstarter and we’ve learned a lot from our previous nine. Producing thousands of products and coordinating their delivery to homes across the planet is a complex business, and there are many things which could go wrong. This is why we build in as much time for the unforeseen as possible. We want to ensure that we have the space to deal with any unexpected setbacks and still get your game to you before the estimated delivery date.

To give you a frame of reference for exactly when you will get your game, Mythic Battles: Pantheon, Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1 and Reichbusters: Projekt Vril have been delivered. Super Fantasy Brawl is going to complete fulfillment by the end of the month. Solomon Kane, a big scope project, is at the printer and will be delivered in two waves. In specific wave 1 is in mass production now and the wave 2 moulds are also now being produced. Time of Legends: Joan of Arc season 1.5 is on track and the first elements will be soon sent to production. Enchanters: East Quest has been printed and is going to ship this month. Steamwatchers is on track and will go to production soon, to make the March fulfilment. HEL: The Last Saga is currently in development.

For all our games, we communicate with our backers with regular updates on Kickstarter and on Gamefound (for our late pledgers) You can also find us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Discord, learn our news and project updates through our weekly Newscast and ask all your questions in our Q&A with Leo on YouTube every Wednesday evening.

Please note that the components, component counts, quality and rules, are all work in progress and subject to change.

Delivery

Our experience in our previous KS has shown us that there can be variances in terms of timing and remaining in schedule when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays
At the same time there are also the unpredictable factors; recently it was the Coronavirus outbreak, but there can be others such as weather conditions, strikes and others.
The estimated delivery date for this project is October 2021, but please bear in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

Shipping

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project.
If you do not finalise your pledge and pay for shipping by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the pledge manager has closed.
If you confirm your pledge by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and that outside of countries specifically listed as being “friendly” (above) you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes or APO addresses.
All backers that have selected “No Reward” on Kickstarter, that wish to receive a reward for this campaign, must make sure to confirm their order by the Pledge Manager Deadline. We will announce the date for this once the Pledge Manager becomes live. All “No Reward” pledges will be treated as donations once the Pledge Manager Deadline has passed.

KSE

As KSE, or Kickstarter Exclusives, are marked the products that will not be available to retail. Mythic Games retains the right to continue to sell those in the Pledge Manager, the Mythic Games website, as well as conventions.

Refunds

We have a no-questions-asked refund policy.
All pledges can be refunded in full up to 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign. In addition, if any part of your order cannot be delivered, then we will reimburse you the full cost of this component regardless of the date.
If you apply for a refund more than 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter then we will only be able to refund 85% of it. The difference is the amount of the unrecoverable fees paid to process your order.
Once we have started to process and pack your order, refunds will no longer be available.
Refunds within the first 14 days are reversed via Stripe to the credit card you used to pledge originally. Any refunds requested after the 14 day period may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe or your credit card. This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will also be in USD.
If these terms are not acceptable to you, then we suggest that you do not participate in this crowdfunding campaign. Thank you for your understanding.

campaign.story:
The Kingdoms of Dünnmere
Long ago the forests were ruled by the great boars and sows of Westerwood. They lived in huge sounders and held council with the other forest tribes. Now they are but a shadow of what they were, finding work where they can as bodyguards, pit-fighters and mercenaries.
Dünnmere is an original fantasy setting inspired by dark folklore. It is filled with all manner of odd critters and characters, and with this Kickstarter I wanted to shed some light on a few of its inhabitants.
The Miniatures
My miniatures are sculpted digitally, then 3d printed and cast in high quality resin. The five main figures (Glömm the Collector, Gruntlac Gatecrusher, Gorgrot, Porgroth the Gluttonous and Olaug) come with 40mm round bases. 
Maggot and Rollo are available as add-ons and come with 25mm round bases.  To add them to your pledge simply add £8 for each one you'd like and at the end of the Kickstarter you will be asked which add-ons you would like.
The three pigs each come with an alternative bare-head.
The miniatures are 28mm scale and are made to be compatible with ranges like Dungeons and Dragons, Age of Sigmar, Frostgrave and any other 28mm miniature based games.
Rollo the Masterful painted
Every miniature comes with an illustrated card, with some backstory about the character and signed by the artist.
One of the original ink drawings available in the Artisan Band tiers.
Shipping & Delivery
Once you have chosen your pledge, you will be asked to add on costs for shipping. Any pledge above Hermit will be tracked shipping and so will cost a bit extra. 
Delivery will be completed by March 2021 or possibly sooner.
Why back the Kickstarter?
You'll be helping me to develop and grow the dark folklore-inspired setting of Dünnmere further.
 You'll receive the miniatures at a reduced price (if you order any pledge higher than Hermit). 
Own miniatures from the first casting. Each figure from the first casting is limited to 200 or 300 copies and the illustrated card will show which number from the casting that you have.
You'll receive the miniatures several months before they become available elsewhere.
You'll be supporting my tiny independent miniatures studio, and helping it to take its first steps.
About
Hi, I’m Jack Good and Monkstone Miniatures is my own little creation. I design, sculpt and illustrate each character, and am writing and developing the setting too.  As a child, I loved stories and films about fantasy worlds like Willow and the Dark Crystal, and they massively influenced my own drawings and stories. I collected Citadel miniatures too, and was always drawn to the smaller games like Mordheim and Warhammer Quest. 
I graduated from the Computer Visualisation and Animation degree at Bournemouth University in 2009 and have been lucky enough to have had an almost ten year career in the video game industry making art. Highlights of this include being on the four-person team that created the Bafta nominated ‘Surgeon Simulator 2013’ and leading the art on 'Worlds Adrift'.
Last year I found myself once again being drawn back to painting minis, and realised I also wanted to sculpt my own characters and to create a world inspired by my loves of folklore, fantasy and history. My aim is to expand the setting of Dünnmere, and to eventually develop stories, games and rulesets to enable you to explore these lands for yourselves.
My focus right now though is on developing the highest quality 28mm resin miniatures for you to use in whatever fantasy setting you choose.
This is my first Kickstarter, and with your support it will hopefully be the first step in our journey together. I am hugely passionate about this project and have big plans for its future.
I really appreciate your support
Thank you
- Jack


Acknowledgements
Massive thanks to Eddie Fisher and the team at Zealot Miniatures for helping to bring my miniatures to life in such amazing detail. Jonathan Betts for the incredible illustration at the beginning of the trailer. Dan from Atlantis Miniatures for his guidance and help. Darren Curtis for the music in the trailer and my amazing fiancé Reena for supporting me throughout. x

updates.update_content: Thanks again! I am massively grateful to all your support and messages along the way.  It has been a fantastic journey and I can't wait to get these minis in to your hands.

With not long left of the campaign, I just wanted to say another massive thankyou for supporting the project and helping me to get this far. 
It's been a busy and exciting few weeks but I managed to grab some time this week to paint up another figure. It's Olaug!

Gruntlac holds a special place in my heart as he is the first miniature that I ever sculpted. I got to the stage of breaking him into parts for mould making and decided to shelve him and work on a simpler miniature, which ended up being Rollo.  
I've always loved the idea of pig-based minotaurs and I tried converting my own (with little success) when I used to collect beastman as a kid. Here is my rendition of Gruntlac painted up!

Olaug was one of my favourite miniatures to sculpt as she has so many interesting details. These include a sickle, a mandrake root, a toad (escaping from a bag), a shield fashioned from a window shutter, and plenty of skulls. She is a member of the Bittlehole coven, and they are a group that I would really like to explore further with future miniatures.
Here is a closer look at Olaug.

campaign.story:
“The old woman fussed and busied about her home. At her feet, three cloth kittens scampered and played as she swept the floor, stoked the fire and straightened the furniture. They were to have visitors. Bundled out of the cottage by the old woman, the kittens darted through the rain and across the clearing to the shelter of the woodshed. A low mournful moan slid through the slatted wood of the shed. The kittens looked at each other, then bolted straight back to the house. Small pebble eyes watched them go.”
Left at the Bottom of the Garden Chapter Two is a project to fund the production of nine high quality, lead-free metal miniatures, each depicting a lost toy. Following on from my previous Kickstarter, our intrepid lost toys have met a new group of toys deep in the forest: the old woman who lives in the woods, her various cloth cats, a toy robin and whatever it is she keeps in the woodshed. 
As the owner and sculptor of Statuesque Miniatures, I've produced many miniatures over the years. However, the Left at the Bottom of the Garden toys are something quite different in style and purpose from my usual work and that's why I've again come to Kickstarter to help reach as many people as possible.  The first Left at the Bottom of the Garden Kickstarter (which I now call 'Chapter One') was successful and fulfilled on time. With your help, I can get production started and continue the tale of Olive, Clementine and Little Puss, and all the other toys they meet in the woods.
The Miniatures
Measuring approximately 13mm to 31mm tall, the Left at the Bottom of the Garden Chapter Two miniatures represent the household of the old woman who lives in the woods - mostly cloth cats. I sculpted the miniatures with tabletop gaming, painting and collecting in mind. In particular, I wanted them to be nice little objects in themselves, needing no glue, no assembly beyond normal casting clean-up, and no plastic bases. They have bold, chunky details meaning they can be easily painted or finished however you wish.
All photos show production castings of the miniatures (either painted or prepped and given a wash of oil paint to bring out the details), so if the Kickstarter is successful I'll be ready to start casting your miniatures immediately. There won't be any stretch goals or additional items added during the course of the campaign - I don't want anything to delay fulfilment.
Please note, due to their small size the Left at the Bottom of the Garden miniatures are not intended for small children.
The Pledges
Below you can see each of the pledge levels available. All miniatures are supplied in a bare metal state.
Choose any set or sets of miniatures from the Add On list below. Simply pledge the total for those sets. Details of your choices will be taken after the campaign.

Additional sets of miniatures can also be chosen from the Add On list below. Simply add the total cost for those sets to the pledge level. Details of your choices will be taken after the campaign.

Additional sets of miniatures can be chosen from the Add On list bellow. Simply add the total cost for those sets to the pledge level. Details of your choices will be taken after the campaign.
Add Ons
The following items can be added to any pledge for the amount indicated. All Add On items are supplied in a bare metal state.

A lone toy hoodie crow can be added to your pledge for £3.50, and comes free with the "Both Chapters' Toys" pledge level.
Shipping Costs
Shipping costs will be collected after the Kickstarter ends - do not include shipping costs in your pledge amount.
The shipping costs will follow the usual Statuesque Miniatures Flat Rate shipping costs based on the Royal Mail's World Zones. Full details of the shipping costs can be seen HERE on the Statuesque website but below is a summary:
 United Kingdom - £2.70
 Europe - £4.30 standard mail or £10.85 tracked
 World Zone 1 - £5.50 standard mail or £10.65 tracked
 World Zone 2 (including Aus and NZ) - £6.30 standard mail or £11.45 tracked
 World Zone 3 (USA only) - £5.55 standard mail or £10.75 tracked
Pledges over £50 will be sent by tracked mail (where available) for the standard mail shipping cost.
Please note, experience has taught me that it is best to send orders to certain counties only by International Tracked services (or if unavailable, International Signed) to ensure prompt delivery. All rewards sent to Russia (Europe shipping), Brazil and Canada (World Zone 1) will be sent by International Tracked mail only and charged appropriately, while rewards sent to Mexico (World Zone 1) will be sent by International Signed mail only and charged appropriately. No criticism of these countries is implied; I just want you to get your rewards as quickly as possible and I've found this to be the best way.
Shipping costs will be collected after the Kickstarter through the Statuesque Miniatures webshop: you will receive a discount coupon to the value of your pledge amount, you will then place an order for your chosen rewards, and upon entering your discount coupon code you will only pay for the shipping costs (and any additional items you may wish to purchase).
It is very important that you check your Kickstarter messages as that is where I will send your discount coupons and information regarding the payment of shipping costs. Please be sure that your Kickstarter account is linked to an email account you check regularly and turn on notifications for Kickstarter messages.
Shipping to the European Union
Please note that while the United Kingdom left the EU on the 31st of January 2020, during the Transition Period it remains in the EU Customs Union and the Single Market.
The Transition Period runs until the 31st of December 2020. As this Kickstarter will be fulfilled during the Transition Period, EU backers' rewards will not be subject to VAT, customs charges or handling fees on import into the EU. As such, this project is EU Friendly.
I'll be posting more photos of the painted toys during the campaign, along with a tutorial on how I painted them. Basically - lots of splatter!

campaign.story:
In Die of the Dead, players play as friendly spirits, helping guide souls back to the land of the living to celebrate Dia de Muertos. The first player to have one of their souls reach the land of the living wins!
Welcome to the journey from the world of the dead to the land of the living... 
We have worked with a cultural consultant and a Mexican artist to really help bring Dia de Muertos to the table and embed the beauty and culture within the game. This has resulted in amazing components, such as our four gorgeous Dia de Muertos caskets, and the 3D nine-step staircase, showing the levels the souls travel on from the World of the Dead to the Land of the Living; as well as papel picado player boards, ofrenda tokens and custom calavera dice. All of these will be used by players as they add souls to the caskets, move the caskets towards the steps, and ascend the steps to the land of the living. Die of the Dead is fully playtested and print ready, so we will be able to get it in people's hands by Dia de Muertos 2021! 
For full rules please check out our current rulebook here: Rules (prototype) . For a full overview please check out this fantastic Chits and Giggles video here
The goal for each player is to get a soul (represented by the dice) to the land of the living. Players do this by adding souls to the caskets, moving the caskets, and then transferring the souls from the casket to the steps.
On a player's turn they choose one of the four caskets. Each casket will do two things, depending upon its location. One will benefit the current player, the other will depend upon the shake of the casket, and could be good, or bad, for all players around the table. Some of the things the caskets allow players to do are:
Players need to consider carefully which caskets they have souls in when deciding which action they wish to do that round, and how they can manoeuvre the caskets to help them win!
In addition, players can gain tokens representing the items from an ofrenda to help them. 
Ofrenda tokens
These will give the player who uses them an edge, or let them change the rules in some way. 
Everything you see here
We're keeping things simple this Kickstarter- everyone who backs the game gets the best version of the game. No different tiers or having to buy expansions before trying out the game. 
In order to make sure this game reaches people before Dia de Muertos 2021 we have chosen realistic stretch goals which won't need any additional playtesting, or add any cost to the shipping of the game.
Unlocked: At £9000 we will upgrade the box art so it looks even better by adding UV spot printing.
Unlocked: At £12000 we will upgrade from screen-printed custom dice to engraved custom dice.
And that's it! Only two stretch goals might seem a small number, but the game is complete, and the last thing we want to do is unbalance it, or make it more expensive to ship. If we do end up far exceeding these then we will put any savings towards subsidising shipping rates even further.
At Radical 8 Games we understand that shipping can be a barrier to backing a game, especially considering the uncertainty around the world at the moment. Therefore we make this guarantee that, no matter what, for UK and US backers the cost of the game & shipping will be less than the MSRP. We would love to be able to offer this to everybody, but we cant guarantee this to be the case with the fees involved in other countries, although we will be offering as cost effective shipping as possible, including a subsidy from us to keep costs down.
All shipping will be charged in the pledge manager after the campaign has ended. All UK, European, American, Canadian and Australian shipping will be done from within that region for friendly shipping.
Update 1st September: We have a new fulfilment partner for customers in China and some other  regions. We can now offer estimated shipping to China for $9, and Japan,  South Korea, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Taiwan,  Thailand & Vietnam for $18.
*Excluding Alaska and Hawaii.
**For more information please just send us a message. 
For Mexico we have chosen to take the steps to subsidise shipping further, we estimate this to be around £13. Please see our most recent update for more on this.
Please check out some videos and thoughts on the game from other people!
For Chits & Giggles have a superb overview here: 
Card and Pixel have an excellent write up here: https://cardandpixel.tumblr.com/post/626960669850451969/die-of-the-dead-a-kickstarter-preview
The Dice Tower have a great in-depth overview here: 
Tantrum House have done a wonderful preview in their own inimitable style (don't forget to check out their outtakes):  
 Board, Deck and Dice have a nice quick overview here: 
Here's an interview we did for Kicking Tables, discussing the game, from conception to production:  
 Update 10th September:
Another great preview, this time from the Hairy Game Lords:
Finally Richard from We're Not Wizards has another excellent written preview:
https://werenotwizards.blogspot.com/2020/09/die-of-dead-radical-8-games-kickstarter.html 
Here's a playthrough we recorded, we've edited out the setup and rules introduction, but hopefully it gives you a sense of how fun the game is (thanks to Nate and Angel for volunteering to be recorded playing)
In addition, if you're interested in reading about how the game was designed, and the thought that went into each part, you can check out our designer diaries on BoardGameGeek or our Website.
A massive Thank You to everybody above for their efforts!
One thing we'd like to do is include all our backers in the choice of new colours for the Casket Boards. The current colours introduce the misconception that they are related to the token boards, because the colours match. To avoid this, and make the game even more colourful, we will be using four different colours for the casket boards. This is where you come in. Below we've got some examples of possible colours we could use for the casket boards: 
If any of these strike your fancy, or if there are other colours you'd like to see, please let us know, either in the comments, or in our online poll! At the end of the campaign we will choose the four most popular contrasting colours. So just tell us your favourites, and together we'll make sure the game looks even more beautiful.
In addition, you can join us on Twitter or Facebook, using the buttons below:
Radical 8 Games is an independent publisher based in York, UK. Our last Kickstarted game, Forks, was funded, manufactured and fulfilled all ahead of schedule in August 2019. Radical 8 Games is run by Mark, who pre-lockdown spent most his time at Beyond Monopoly! boardgame club playing Agricola when he wasn't playtesting Die of the Dead. Designer James Allen runs Leeds Playtesting with Playtest UK, and has worked hard not only on his own games, but improving games for all designers in the group. Rusembell is an exceptional artist from Mexico, and you can check out more of her amazing artwork here: https://www.deviantart.com/rusembell.
Thanks to the following: all our playtesters, everyone who supports Playtest UK, everyone at Beyond Monopoly (especially those who had to put up with Mark forcing people to play some of those early builds), the HGS boardgame club, Angel for the bread, Jason, Will & Sean for 'Wellbeing Wednesdays' and everyone who stopped by for a chat at Airecon or Virtual UKGE.
And you, for supporting us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Whilst this is our second Kickstarter, and we successfully fulfilled our first quickly and efficiently, there are two things which may crop up as challenges regarding this project, and it would be foolish to not acknowledge them: Brexit and Covid-19.

If a second wave of Covid-19 hits there will be two possible results. Either delays in manufacturing, or increased costs to shipping. What we can do about delays in manufacturing is very limited, and although we hope we have built in enough spare time to still meet the deadline of Dia de Muertos 2021, if there are delays we promise to keep everyone updated at least once every two weeks regarding them.
If there is an increased cost to shipping we will look to bear that burden ourselves. Again, all backers will be kept updated with anything that might happen regarding a second wave of Covid-19.

Brexit is only of concern to UK backers- we will be using fulfilment centres in all parts of the world including the EU, so only UK backers would be affected by this. As we are expecting a significant number of backers to come from the UK, this shouldn't actually affect anybody too badly, as making sure games get here will be a priority. We are working with fulfilment centres in the UK, and will keep on talking to them about Brexit, especially as more is known. Again, the main issues will be increased shipping costs and possible delays, but as Radical 8 Games is based in the UK, we will be working overtime to make sure the games get here with minimum delays and will bear any additional costs.

In the USA the games have finally passed through customs, and Fulfillrite received them today. They have been fantastic with processing this and have already begun to ship the games out. They should finish shipping them all by the end of next week, hopefully even earlier.

Hi everyone, just another quick shipping update- as you may have seen in the comments some games have already started to arrive with backers in Asia! Thanks to Joachim from So Many Games, So Little Time, for posting an unboxing video here . 
Additionally, today we were told that the games have arrived in Australia. All shipping details will be sent over today for backers in Australia and New Zealand, so hopefully backers in those countries should receive the game soon as well.

Join the community on the ArcWorlde Facebook group!
ArcWorlde: Second Edition - The Imperials introduces a new Faction to collect, paint and play for the narrative fantasy battle game from Warploque Miniatures.
ArcWorlde: Second Edition is a narrative battle game set in a whimsical fantasy world, where you play exciting story-driven scenarios on the tabletop.
The Giantess
Players use their wits, tactical skill and outside-of-the-box creative thinking to play fun and memorable clashes between heroes, warbands and monsters in a game that is quick, engaging and easy to learn, with beautiful hand-sculpted miniatures.

 Adding Existing ArcWorlde products
If you would like to add existing ArcWorlde products from the webstore to your pledge, you can absolutely do so! This will be arranged via the Pledge Manager, and more information will be posted soon.
The cost of shipping is not included in your pledge, and will be added after the conclusion of the campaign through the pledge manager.
I will provide you all with full instructions when the time comes. I am still finalising the exact shipping costs, but to give you a rough idea here are a couple of preliminary estimates:
TREASURE MAP: - £0 unless used to purchase miniatures in the campaign.
TROOPER/PLATOON/COHORT: £4 to the UK, £12 US, £10 ROW.
BRIGADE/GIANTESS: £5 to the UK, £15 US, £12 ROW.
These estimates may increase if you purchase a large number of additional models on top of your core pledge. The final shipping costs are subject to change, and will be based on your location and specific rewards.
For those of you in the EU - as with everyone else, we have no idea what the outcome of Brexit will be on shipping costs, including any potential tariffs. We will keep you all updated as we find out more.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any undertaking of this nature is a huge commitment and a lot of work for everyone involved. Miniatures need sculpting, manufacturing, packing and eventually shipping to the backers.

It is at these hurdles that some Kickstarters have faltered in the past, so, I have given careful consideration to each part of the process to minimise potential risk. Warploque Miniatures is a family run business, so everyone involved is 100% dedicated to making this project as successful and professional as possible. My father is our resin caster, my mother is in charge of packing and shipment, and our metal caster is a tried and tested craftsman we have worked with for over four years.

Also, instead of relying purely on concept art and work-in-progress sculpts to illustrate my products, all of the initial models that I am offering have already been sculpted. They've been cast, the display copies have been painted, and they are ready to go into production, so backers know exactly what they are investing in. I will be relying on Work in Progress sculpts and concept art for some of the stretch goals, but be assured that they will be completed and cast in a timely manner once the campaign has been funded.

Finally, I have set achievable delivery date estimates. I have kept the campaign small and manageable, eschewing an overly long list of stretch goals, so this project has a much higher probability of being completed and delivered on time.

campaign.story:
Minos is the new  miniature for my range: SIMONMINIATURES , 90 mm of brutality in the service of the Barbarian clan. After the success of my first ks "The Saga of Belius the black",  I launch "The Legend of Minos". For those who do not know me, I sculpt miniatures in Fimo in a traditional way, for more than 20 years. Before for Rackham for 9 years, then for different freelance company, notably Mierce Miniatures, Monolith with Conan, Mythic Battles and Claustrophobia, successes on Kickstarter. 
Minos, 90 mm and Lothart, 35 mm
Minos, 90 mm
 Kickstarter is the ideal platform to develop personal work for my range: SIMONMINIATURES . It allows me to create the molds for my sculptures and thus satisfied all the fans of my work. Jérémie Dès is my caster, he was the wonderful caster of Rackham. Minos is accompanied by Beowulf, barbarian champion, he will command Angus and Branag on the battlefields without weakening. Lothart is a combat druid, skilled at the sword, he guesses the signs sent by the gods and whispers in the ears of the creatures of the Elebore forest.
The Goals (Stretch Goals / SG ) of the campaign are the sums to be reached to unlock miniatures. These amounts are listed on the left side of the photo.For unlocked a miniature you can add the price of this miniature to the amount of your pledge, (indicat at the bottom right of the card if you want to receive this miniature). So you can build your pledge the way you want.
                                               Same goes for Addons, they are optional, increase your pledge by the price of the miniature of your choice.
                                               If you want the same miniature in several copies, increase your pledge by the same amount (example if you want Beowulf in 2 copies increase your pledge by 2X14 = 28 €)
                                               The miniatures are not assembled (a tube of cyano glue is enough, the resin sticks very well) unpainted and without bases.
FRENCH VERSION:
Minos est la nouvelle figurine sculpté pour ma gamme SIMONMINIATURES, 90 mm de brutalité au service du clan Barbare. Après le succès de la Saga de Bélius le noir, et j'en remercie tout les fans de mon travail, je lance la Légende de Minos. Pour ceux qui ne me connaissent pas, je sculpte des figurines en Fimo de manière traditionnelle, depuis plus de 20 ans. Avant pour Rackham pendant 9 ans, puis pour différentes marques en freelance, notemment Mierce Miniatures, Monolith avec Conan, Mythic Battles et Claustrophobia, des succès sur Kickstarter.
 Kickstarter est la plateforme idéal pour développer des travaux personnels comme ma gamme SIMONMINIATURES. Elle me permet de créer les moules pour tirer mes sculptures en résines et ainsi contenté tout les fans de mon travail.
Minos est accompagné de Beowulf, champion barbare, il commandera Angus et Branag sur les champs de bataille sans faiblir. Lothart est un druide de combat, habile à l'épée, il devine les signes envoyés par les dieux et chuchote à l'oreilles des créatures de la forêt Elebore.
Lothart, barbarian druid, 35 mm
Les Objectifs(Stretch Goals/SG en anglais) de la campagne sont les sommes à atteindre pour débloquer des figurines. Ces sommes sont inscrites sur le côté gauche de la photo. Pour débloquer une figurine vous pouvez ajouter, au montant de votre pledge le prix de la figurine,indiqué sur la carte(en bas à droite)  si vous voulez recevoir cette figurine. Ainsi vous construisez votre pledge comme vous le souhaitez. Même chose pour les Ajouts (addons en anglais), ils sont optionnels, augmentez votre pledge du prix de la figurine de votre choix.
Beowulf, barbarian champion 35 mm
Si vous voulez la même figurine en plusieurs exemplaires, augmentez d'autant votre pledge (exemple si vous voulez Beowulf en 2 exemplaires augmentez votre pledge de 2X14=28€)
Les figurines ne sont pas assemblées (un tube de colle cyano suffit, la résine colle très bien) non peintes et sans socles.

Join us for our final Closing Stream on Friday March 6th, starting at 8am PST/11am EST, and count down the end of the campaign with us! Click here to join the stream.

                              ※ご支援については、キックスターターページ（英語）からお願いいたします。
The Wonderful 101 is a “Unite Action” action-adventure game developed by PlatinumGames Inc., directed by action game luminary Hideki Kamiya, and originally released on the Nintendo Wii U. 
In this game, players take control of the Wonderful Ones, heroes from all over the world chosen to defend the Earth from all manner extraterrestrial threats! When the peaceful Blossom City comes under attack by alien invaders, Wonder-Red, Wonder-Blue, and the rest of the Wonderful Ones suit up and unite to save the world!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered will be released on Nintendo Switch, with versions for other platforms becoming available via stretch goals. We also plan to add a host of amazing extras as stretch goals are met, with the goal of making The Wonderful 101: Remastered the definitive depiction of our heroes’ exploits!
#ALLFOR101
Physical copies of The Wonderful 101: Remastered distributed as backer rewards will include a Special Backers Only Kickstarter-exclusive cover! Additionally, backers will receive DLC unlocked via stretch goals for FREE!
Unite with fellow backers and participate in this live Social Media Challenge to unlock even more rewards!
#ALLFOR101
Blossom City Reward Unlocks:
Mission 1: COMPLETE: Sticker Set increased by 31!
Mission 2: COMPLETE: Acrylic Standee size increased from iPhone size to iPad size!
Mission 3: COMPLETE: Add 20 pages to the artbook!
Mission 4: COMPLETE: Sticker Set increased by 31!
Mission 5: COMPLETE: Papercraft Face Mask (in PDF form!)
Mission 6: COMPLETE: A secret look at Kamiya's desk
Mission 7: 3290 Retweets: Membership reward upgrade from paper to plastic!
Mission 8: COMPLETE: Sticker increased by 31 for a total of 101!
Mission 9: COMPLETE: The softcover physical artbook becomes hardcover!
Mission 10: COMPLETE: Membership reward upgrade from paper to plastic!
Mission 11: COMPLETE: Additional Collaborators will be added to the Remix album
Mission 12: COMPLETE: Kamiya unblocks everyone!

What is The Defense of Blossom City?
The Defense of Blossom City is a Social Media Challenge for all backers to play during the Kickstarter campaign. The game will start with a single Wonderful One traveling through Blossom City on the Virgin Victory, protecting the city from invaders.
The size of the Wonderful Team will grow by 1 member every 500 backers.
Each new member on the team will raise your Wonder Power. The more Wonder Power gained throughout the campaign, the easier it will become to clear social goals, and unlock awesome new rewards for all backers to enjoy!
Get Blocked by Kamiya
 Not everyone has had the privilege of being blocked on Twitter by the illustrious Hideki Kamiya, but that’s all about to change. At a very special Kickstarter tier, Kamiya himself will tweet directed to you, and then will block you forever!
NOTE: This is an optional reward! You do not have to be blocked by Kamiya if you do not want to be!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered Digital Version
Right on! A Digital Key for TW101, straight from P-Star to you!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered Digital Double Pack
A double dose of The Wonderful 101: Remastered Digital Version. Get each one on the platform of your choice! Keep them both, or give one to a friend. The choice is yours!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered Physical Version
Looking for something more... physical? This is the physical edition of The Wonderful 101: Remastered, with backer exclusive box art!
Double/Physical Combo
A double punch of The Wonderful 101: Remastered goodness, this tier includes both a physical and a digital copy of the game, so you can keep one for your collection, and one for quick access on-the-go!
The Wonderful 101: Remastered Physical Double Pack
A double dose of The Wonderful 101: Remastered, in a box! Get each one on the platform of your choice! Whether you want it on two different platforms, or want to gift one to a friend, this might just be for you.

101 Keychain
Hold on to a little piece of the W101 wherever you go! This is a gold keychain emblazed with the burning red justice of the W101!
Wonderful Sticker Set
UV coated 2" vinyl stickers of the main cast of heroes, perfect for indoor or outdoor use.
Centinels Identification Card
Show your allegiance to the CENTINELS with this Wonderful 101 card, a recreation of the membership badge  card each Wonderful One gets upon joining the cause.
Wonder-Pendant
While not actually equipped with a Psychic Switch, this recreation of the Wonder-Pendant owned by every Wonderful One will show the world that you're ready to save the world at the first sign of trouble!
Wonderful T-shirt
Represent The Wonderful 101! This tee signifies your support of the W101, and your hidden power to help them defeat evil!
The Wonderful 101 Digital Comic
Follow the adventures of the Wonderful Ones in a brand new Kickstarter exclusive comic book, in digital PDF form!
The Wonderful 101 Physical Comic
Follow the adventures of the Wonderful Ones in a brand new Kickstarter exclusive comic book, in classic paperback form!
Wonderful Acrylic Diorama
 The Wonderful Ones strike iconic poses on their own, but together, they can’t be beat! This acrylic diarama features three layers of Blossom City’s greatest heroes, and their iconic logo.
Wonderful Artbook
A soft cover art book that contains the artistic creation of the game from the team at Platiunum Games!
Abridged Digital Soundtrack
Jam out to The Wonderful 101 with a digital download of The Wonderful 101's Abridged Soundtrack, a selection of music tracks from the game's full soundtrack!
Abridged CD Soundtrack
Want to pump yourself up with some super jams? This is the physical edition of the Abridged soundtrack, perfect for your car stereo!
The FULL Soundtrack
Need even more music? This 5 disc CD set contains all the songs from The Wonderful 101: Remastered, plus a free digital download!
Vinyl Record
Get it on Wax! For the first time ever, we're offering a Platinum selection of songs from The Wonderful 101: Remastered on 12" vinyl!
Wonderful Keshi Figures
Individually they’re great, but together, they’re Wonderful! Each of these Wonderful One toys is ready to handle evil on its own, but together, they make for an adorable, multicolored army! No one will be able to stop them!
Custom Controllers
Want a little more flair in your gaming? These custom hand painted controllers are made one of a kind for you!
Artbook "Thank You"
Have your name honored in the art book! You'll get a credit for helping make the game possible!
Super Platinum Trophy
It’s a really special feeling when you complete a level in The Wonderful 101: Remastered with the highest score and receive that beautiful platinum trophy. Well, now you can bring that feeling to life with the limited edition physical platinum trophy, full size and ready to sit on your shelf.
Wonder-Mask
When fighting the forces of evil, it’s best to keep your identity secret, and there’s no better way to do it than with an authentic replica of the Wonder-Mask, painstakingly created to be worn!
Wonder-Red Jacket
If you’re going to save the world, you need to do it in style. That’s why we’re offering a limited number of leather jackets, styled after Wonderful 100’s illustrious team strategist, Will Wedgewood, better known as Wonder-Red.
Framed Button Display
An 18" x 24" framed display of all the badges from The Wonderful 101: Remastered! Perfect for the button or justice enthusiast!
12" Wonder-Red Figure
A custom made 12" figure of Wonder-Red! Let them stand vigilant over and always be on the lookout for evil! Mock-ups and more detailed info on this Wonderful reward will come in a future update!
PlatinumGames Studio Tour
Join The Wonderful 101: Remastered team for a full tour of the office, and experience the chance to be a director for a day. You're the head honcho now! What will you do with all that power?
NOTE: Transportation and hotel fees during time spent in Osaka are the responsibility of the rewardee.
*This tour may include parts that cannot be photographed and must be kept confidential.


The young leader of the Wonderful 100. Having just joined the Wonderful Ones after finishing a year of comprehensive training, Earth Defense War III is his first experience in combat.
Though technically still a rookie, he is extremely gifted, achieving a record score in both the written and field sections of the CENTINEL tactical examinations. Brimming with passion for justice, he takes a firm stance against those who threaten peace, but his by the books attitude and serious personality can occasionally rub people the wrong way. Sometimes Red's seriousness crosses the realm of reason, and those around him find getting through to him almost impossible. The opposite is rarer, though, as Red has an incredible memory, and never forgets something after being told.
His deep crimson CENTINEL-Suit boasts balance in all levels of performance, demonstrating diverse aptitude in any mission. The Vulcan Knuckles equipped to both his arms are capable of intense blows and machine-like accuracy, which can be even further increased in power via the "Unite Hand" Unite Morph technique.

A Wonderful One whose cover occupation is as a detective for the Los Angeles Police Department. Though young, he has gained experience and success in a variety of missions: taking down warring mafia families, counter-terrorism, and even taking part in military operations.
Having a strong sense of identity, and a stronger dislike for authority, Blue is not the easiest Wonderful One to deal with in the organization; however, his ability to act quickly and make decisions in the blink of an eye has led to a chain of successful missions. Yet, despite these successes, his hot-headed personality has makes Blue prone lose himself in anger, peppering his record with a significant number of failures.
Blue insists on making a scene for everyone to see, so in combat he acts arrogant, taunting the enemy, and is prone to posturing into different poses that might look "cool." Unfortunately, reactions to his antics are conspicuous in their absence.
Poor at teamwork and preferring to work alone, Blue does not actively try seek meaningful relationships with others. Instead, he accepts only those who are able to prove their skills, but this acceptance leads to a deep respect.
His weapon, the Valiantium Blade, is said to become sharper with every slice, forged with a special alloy able to cut through anything in the galaxy. His Unite Sword can deal lethal blows to even battleships.
Chose to be a Wonderful One due to his incredible skill with firearms and other ranged weapons, Wonder-Green is currently a mere middle school student. Yet, despite his youth, it is said that he can shoot through the hole of a donut a 100 kilometers away, while eating a donut himself.
Possibly due to his privileged upbringing, he often seems to feel like the world revolves around him and is prone to ignoring the reality of his surroundings. He also unwittingly rude, leading to occasional clashes with Blue and Pink; clashes Green himself seems unbothered by. In fact, at least with Pink, he almost seems to enjoy being scolded.
Even during the tensest of missions, he possesses a completely carefree nature; that is until something goes south, then he instantly breaks into panic. Far clumsier than most would ever suspect for a Wonderful One, the world prays that the care with which Green uses his rapid-fire proton gun Christine Daaé is another, more careful, side of him that holds great pride in his position. (Or so the world hopes...)
He has developed a close friendship with Black, as both are similar in age and love video games, comics, cartoons, and general mischief-making. This mischief-making extends to his love of junk food, a forbidden fruit under his parents, but a near constant indulgence as Green partakes in missions far beyond their strict reach.

Chosen to go to the Olympics in gymnastics while still in high school, Wonder-Pink is by far the most flexible and agile of any Wonderful One. She matches this with an advanced proficiency in melee weaponry, specifically with her Beautiful Whip, knit from a next-gen stay-press alloy "Belmont alloy," for which she is unrivaled.
Pink is known for her "laissez-faire" personality, behaving carefree and sunny during even the most severe missions, as if her duties were just another after school club; however, it is that relaxed attitude that, more often than not, spells disaster for the team. Exceedingly sensitive towards trends, she has decorated her issued weapon with a variety of accessories, and her tendency to prioritize fashion over the mission can occasionally give her superiors headaches. Nevertheless, Pink's excellent physical aptitude and peerless acrobatics have led the team to countless victories.
Extremely emotional, she sometimes reveals her terrifying true colors when angered. Pink is especially sensitive to anything said by Green, and she will gladly turn her tormentor into her whipping boy when set off.
Plus many many more heroes!
In The Wonderful 101: Remastered, you don’t just control a single superhero. You control a whole team, united to face off against the forces of evil. As you travel around the city, you’ll rescue civilians, who will then join your cause, bolstering your ranks.
The Wonderful Ones have more than just numbers on their side. To solve puzzles and smash evil, the Wonderful Ones can perform a “Unite Morph”, combining together to create fists, swords, bridges and other incredible constructs.
Together with Wonder Red, Wonder Blue, and the rest of the Wonderful Ones, it’s time to save Blossom City, and the rest of the world!
The most powerful tool for the Wonderful Ones is the incredible Unite Morph. By combining together, the Wonderful Ones can turn into a variety of awesome shapes, from whips to swords to giant fists.
In-game, players draw specific shapes on the battlefield with the control stick, and the Unite Morph initiates!
Unite Morphing isn’t just for combat, though! The Wonderful Ones can use their powers for traversal as well, whether it’s a faraway ladder or a precarious rope bridge, there’s nowhere The Wonderful 100 can’t reach!
Unite Hand
PLAY

The famous fist of justice used by Wonder Red, Unite Hand is the Wonderful Ones’ most basic Unite Morph. Used to pummel, smash and brutalize foes, the Unite Hand can also be used to rotate cogs and empty gacha monsters of their contents.
Unite Sword
PLAY

While not as strong as the Unite Hand, the Unite Sword has a longer reach, and is sharp enough to cut through chains. As an added bonus, the Unite Sword’s pristine broad side can also reflect lasers back at enemies.
Unite Gun
PLAY

While the Unite Gun isn’t one of the strongest Unite Morphs in the Wonderful Ones' arsenal, it really shines in long distance situations. The gun can hit both enemies and environmental objects, allowing the Wonderful Ones to defeat distant foes or solve otherwise inaccessible puzzles. 
Unite Whip
PLAY

The Unite Whip is a Unite Morph created from combining with a flexible, thorned whip. Not only can it attack enemies from afar, it can also tie them up, making it perfect for dealing with armored foes, spiked walls, and other prickly surfaces. It can also be used to latch onto certain surfaces to swing the whole team over gaps.

Foreword
For over 35 years Kevin Adams has been producing original and high-quality miniature fantasy figures, building up an amazing following and reputation especially around goblins.
In recent times Kevin has helped friends and compatriots establish businesses all around the world using his reputation and design skills; however this has sometimes come at a price. This price is that Kevin has been commissioned to produce figures as described by others, as opposed to being totally creative in terms of originality. 
Goblinmaster Limited has been created to be dedicated to return Kevin’s creative modelling to the original ethos of high-quality products that have humorous and quirky elements, that are true to the fantasy gaming community. Kevin is a major shareholder of the new business and may eventually become Kevin’s sole vehicle for conceptualising, designing and delivering his artwork. Keep an eye out for the Goblinmaster copyright as this will now become Kevin’s unadulterated brand, where quality and originality can be safeguarded.
Over the coming year the wish is to produce 16 ranges/sets of products (most directly from the Goblinmaster website), all with the original, and somewhat ‘old school’ style; the very first model pack will be the Treadmill of Hubris, where Kevin has used his own ideas to produce a set-piece wagon, artifacts, characters, and narrative.  To achieve this we need initial support, both in terms of kick-start funding, plus a guide as to what ideas work and what doesn't.
This ‘kick-start’ is to bring Kevin’s imaginary world once again alive, and to launch his unique artwork for the fantasy world.  Kevin would like to set up a fully-fledged website (goblinmaster.online)  where his work can be seen and purchased without the need for 'kick-starts'.  He can then merrily take requests from supporters as to product lines and ideas, or he can work on his pet-projects and the beloved Goblin families and the situations they find themselves in, that have made his life such fun!
 Please note that the current range are created from scratch; no characters have been adapted from existing models (and no goblins were harmed in the process).
Treadmill of Hubris
As we all know, Dwarfs love their ale; and in this, they have a weakness, and often come a cropper.  The treadmill of hubris is a true demonstration of this.
The backdrop is that the goblins (in this case, Boglets, a small variant of goblin, that takes delight in trickery, cunning, and humiliation of their foe), having discovered a couple of Dwarfs drunk next to their barrel of ale, captures and enslaves them.  It is normal for Boglets to use the Dwarfs own barrel of beer as the cornerstone of their enslavement, and they do this with great mirth and delight in what the Boglets have coined, the Treadmill of Hubris.
It is a simple story; upon capture, the Dwarfs plead for their live, and seemingly being magnanimous the Boglets agree on the basis that they will commit to being slaves until their barrel of ale has become exhausted and the Dwarfs have fully sobered up.  The Boglets then use the barrel as the treadmill and lash the Dwarfs to a control bar to support them as they ‘tread’.
Unbeknownst to the Dwarfs, the Boglets urinate in the barrel to keep it topped up (apparently 5 Boglets can produce sufficient urine so as to perpetually feed the Dwarfs – there is some science behind this, but that is another story). The Boglets add some strange fungi to the brew and produce a slightly hallucinogenic and intoxicating liquid that fool the Dwarfs into believing it is their ale.
The Boglets have no intention of ever letting their foe go….. Over the following weeks and sometimes months, the Boglets pimp-up their Treadmill wagon, and in this case it has a grinder and smasher; the team of Boglets are using snappers to encourage the Dwarfs when moving at ‘battle-speed’, and some other Boglets use a dung-barrel to dump onto their foe in battle.
We don’t know what happens to the Dwarfs, they usually only last a couple of months; the Boglets either capture a new brace of Dwarfs, or dump the wagon.  Given the stature of the Dwarfs in this image, they are clearly new to the treadmill, cursing each other for not pulling their weight and for snoozing whilst drinking ale, thus causing their capture.  The Hubris bit is so the Boglets can have another laugh at the expense of the Dwarfs … Dutch courage an’ all.  Dwarfs are way-too-proud and over-confident to be left without a Boglet ribbing.
Treadmill Casting
Treadmill Front
Treadmill Back
Treadmill Side
Closer view of the Boglet crew (only 6 pieces shown)
The Treadmill of Hubris Boglet Crew is available to be pledged separately, however it is specifically designed to be used with the war wagon, and therefore does not have a base-insert. 
(Boglets have thin pegs so that there is freedom to drill holes anywhere in the base or roof thus allowing kustomisation of individual waggons and you could add that and soon we will have more Boglets that can be added or used as replacements for the Krew allowing for further individual kustomisation)
PAINTED PICTURES COMING SOON!
Baleful Boglet Bounders
Boglets usually group in squads of between 6 and 10 beings; lead by a peer who has the greatest reputation for combining spite and irony.  The ability to think up and create new demeaning treatment of their friends and foe alike determines the success of each squad. Boglets if anything, are adaptive and experimental, using whatever is at hand to be their weapon of choice.
In this set, they use a variety of 'tools' to exercise their malice and malevolence, some designed to incapacitate their foe, others designed to purely humiliate.  Boglets, their height usually no more than an adult man's leg, will use attacks that are either high-level, or play to their strengths at lower levels; snappers with Boglet lancers are part of the 'and' world, the lance targets the enemy's upper-torso, and the snapper targets the lower;  one bight can easily sever a leg from a man, however they are often trained to attack softer regions.  Snappers have powerful legs, and can be trained to jump, sometimes Boglets have been known to use them a bit like bouncing-sticks and bouncing balls, riding them with glee.
Word is that some Boglet Baddasses are being created later this year;  these are irksome creatures who care very little for any form of public decency and honour.  They are the most-ignoblest of life-forms, with their sole aim to humiliate others, and to be repulsive.  Kevin will rue the day these beggars were spawned on his workbench ....
All 8 Bounders
Wily Waggeries
A little known fact of wizards is that their pointed hats are very precious to them; besides their quarterstaff, a wizard's hat is considered what defines the person who wears it.  And boy, don’t the goblins all know this !!!  As part of inciting and goading wizards, Boglets will try, often to their demise, to target the wizards hat in an attack.  If they ever get hold of it, they will often urinate in the bearded-ones favourite clothing.  Wizards are not as liberal as one may believe, and will become incensed by this act and will often go berserk, killing the Boglets in an instance.  However the Boglets don’t really care, the humour and insult are well worth the consequence; their names often become legendary and part of Boglet folklore.
Don't get me started on what Boglets would do to a Wizard's Spell Book ...!!!
As for the wizard who has the misfortune of losing their hat, their peers sometime offer great support in dealing with the emotional upset, but their reputation can be irreparably tarnished. 
Pesky Boglets!
NEWSFLASH ....... NEWSFLASH .....  Kev has just given an update on the Wily Waggeries ....
The Boglets have majorly overlooked an important tool of the Wizard..... the Wizard Bertram Baptiste Bap has a very powerful wand tucked away up his sleeve. The wizard, partly out of anger, and partly out of exasperation, launches a spell using the wand ..... a spell incorrectly spoken as the spell book had been defiled, with a broken and emotional voice.  BANG !!!  The incantations were to direct the wand to turn these pesky goblins into fungus.  But no.  What was actually uttered by Baptiste turned these Boglets into a new and terrifying breed of goblin.  May the Great Goblin God forgive us ... for Baptiste has sinned ....
For those folk who pledged the £135 or more will be getting *** FREE OF CHARGE *** one of these new lines of Goblin as part of the package
Look out for these new creatures on the website after this Kickstarter !!!!
The Oddgoblin
This new model is 20mm tall, so fits in with the existing scale of the Boglets.  Wizards can be good creatures, but sometimes they can be foolish - these creatures will come to haunt and plague the other beings in the world .... what have you done, Baptiste !!!?

The Goblinmaster (limited edition)
Kevin designed a 'punk' goblin many years ago - purely for personal consumption, never manufactured or displayed anywhere other than amongst family.  As part of this kickstart release, Goblinmaster will create a limited edition EXCLUSIVELY for those who support this funding initiative (for example, if 200 people request a copy on KIckstarter, then only 200 will be produced).
But beware, The Goblinmaster is the Manneken Pis of the Goblin World !!
Will be available for pledges at £10 if the stretch goal is met!
The old punk goblin (Kev will make a new one)
The new Goblin Master

What else is included?
- Custom Packaging
- Guarantees for damaged goods
- Directly supporting the artist!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At this point in the development cycle, the key risks are that we are trying to use recyclable materials, low- or zero-lead metals, and other environmentally friendly approaches. This means that there are no plastics, and therefore many packaging techniques are new and fresh, especially for this market. We are employing a specialist packaging company to support us.
This is Goblinmaster's first kickstarter - we think we have most risks covered, but as the Goblin entrepreneur Slippery-Boar has a habit of saying, "I can only promise you as much troll dung as you can eat". We will make mistakes, but you and other backers shouldn't suffer as a consequence.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
With the success of our previous AUS30K Event Models, the Knight House Envoy and Engineer, we are continuing the tradition into 2020. This time however we have decided to change direction in the theme of the model itself and we will be creating a Privateer character; Gabrielle Kalothetos, the captain of a powerful interstellar ship exploring the fringes of Imperial space.
Like our 2019 model, Gabrielle will come in two poses, a standard release pose which will be available for general sale and an exclusive event variant which is intended to be used by Event Organisers as prize support or event swag. This is to try and maintain some exclusivity for the Event models but still give people an opportunity to buy a variant of the model if they don't think they will attend an event which will have it available. The model itself was designed by Nuclear Shrimp Studios and the artwork of Gabrielle was done by Simartian, Siman Vlaisavljević (https://www.artstation.com/simartian).
Privateer Gabrielle Kalothetos
Something new which we are introducing with this project is the inclusion of the exclusive Pledge Coins. In the past whenever planning our project we have always tried to find something to show our appreciation to the backers and thank them for supporting the projects at this stage, during the Kickstarter. This is something we hope will fill that niche for both this project and future ones. The Pledge Coins themselves are 40mm metal coins with the AUS30K logo on one side and a unique design on the reverse face representing the project they are linked to. Each backer who supports the project with a pledge that has a physical reward will receive a coin with their pledge when it arrives. The design for this project is the iconic Corinthian helm which Gabrielle own helmet is modeled off.
The Pledge Coin for the Privateer Gabriel Kalothetos 2020 Event Model Kickstarter
Like the previous event model project we have already completed the 3D design of the model itself and will be starting to create the masters for the mold making process. It is hopeful that we will get images of both the masters before the project completes to give you, the backer an opportunity to see a physical model, not just a render.
PLAY

General Sale version above
PLAY

Event Exclusive version above
INDIVIDUAL PLEDGES
The current range of models available to the Individual pledges are shown below and include;
Privateer Gabrielle Kalothetos (2020 Event model, general sale only)
Knight House Engineer (2019 Event model, general sale only)
Knight House Envoy (2018 Event model)
Maggot Men (all three variants available, each counts as one model)
Now unlocked and only available at this price as part of the Kickstarter!
Puppet Master 
Puppet Master Portal - Human Male 
Puppet Master Portal - Human Female
Puppet Master Portal - Marine
Any combination of these models may be selected in your pledge, but only pledges which contain a Privateer will qualify for a Pledge Coin.
Puppet Master (Unlocked via Stretch Goals)
Puppet Master Portal - Human Male WIP (Unlocked via Stretch Goals)


EVENT SUPPORT PLEDGES
Event Support pledges have access to all of the above models in addition to the Event Exclusive variant of the Privateer model, at least half of the models in an Event Support Pledge must be the Privateer. Only a single Pledge Coin is supplied.
The event exclusive version, only available through the Event Pledge
ADD ONS
To accompany this model all backer can also access products from our previous Unarmoured Marine project to add onto their pledges. 
Unarmoured Marines
These were the second models we produced and funded through Kickstarter in late 2017. They comprise of 5 uniquely posed models without powered armour, intended to represent prisoners of war stripped of their protection. They come in two sizes, regular and extra large, the latter is in line with the Primaris sized models.
            Individuals can add a set of these to their pledge for $44 for the regular size or $49 for the extra large (normally $49/$54 respectively).
            Event Organisers can add individual models (a minimum of ten) to their pledges for $7.50 each or $8 each for the extra large size. These pledges will contain an even (as much as possible) distribution of the five different poses.
STRETCH GOALS
In the event that the project funds over and above the goal we have some Stretch Goals planned;
UNLOCKED - Unit Reference Card
Each Privateer model (Individual and Event pledges), will be accompanied by a unit reference card containing the Gabrielle's custom rules and statistics.
UNLOCKED $2,000 - Floating Puppet Master Model
This model will be made available as an add ons for all pledges and will also include a unit reference card. For the Kickstarter only this model, if unlocked, will be the same price as a regular infantry model!! $15 (or $13 if you are an early bird) to add or simply counts as a single model in a multi model pledge!
UNLOCKED $3,000 - Puppet Master Portal (Human Male) Model 
UNLOCKED $3,500 - Puppet Master Portal (Human Female) Model 
UNLOCKED $4,000 - Puppet Master Portal (Marine) Model 
All three of these models will be made available as an add ons for all pledges and will also include a unit reference card. For the Kickstarter only this model, will be the same price as a regular infantry model!! $15 (or $13 if you are an early bird) to add or simply counts as a single model in a multi model pledge!
 $5,000 Puppet Master Portal Upgrade LOCKED
The Pupper Master Portal will be upgraded with the option to attach an emerging Puppet Master.
$6000 LOCKED TBC

Pickup @ Adepticon 2020!
For Backers who will be attending Adepticon 2020, we will be there and can offer an option to pickup your pledges from our Trade stand. More details on that will be provided closer to the date of the event.
Postage
Like many projects before us we have been stung by the price rises of international postage. Because of this we have had to move the shipping cost component to the pledge manager stage shortly before fulfillment. Currently the costs post to international destinations are listed below, with luck this will not change between now and the fulfillment stage. These prices are based on bulk mail out orders, if individuals need their pledge sent separately, the cost may be higher then what is listed here.

            New Zealand 
            Up to 500g: $15  (around two dozen models)
North America, Western Europe, Asia and the Pacific
            Up to 250g: $15  (around a dozen models)
            Up to 500g: $20  (around two dozen models)
Rest of the world

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our fifth project creating a model along with the trials and tribulations of production and distribution. We have worked closely with both 3rd parties involved in this particular project and are confident that we have ironed out any teething problems from the previous experiences.
The model itself has been fully designed already and as the project goes live the master has been printed and is in preparation for the mold creation. This will significantly speed up the production time, although it did require a lot more up front investment.
The major hiccup which we encountered on the last Kickstarter project was the international distribution. This came about from relying on a courier who had assured us that they would have rolled out international pickup to our location in time for our fulfillment. This did not happen and so were forced to instead ship the individual parcels in a single bulk lot to a secondary pickup location from where they were then dispatched. This caused some delays in the 2nd and 3rd wave for international backers.
We have taken steps to prevent this from occurring again with alternative courier contracts and other methods for distribution.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hi all,
Apart from 6 pledges who have requested combined shipping and 4 backers who havent completed their survey/paid their invoices, all pledges have now been posted. This has certainly been the longest fulfillment in our projects and for that I apologise, it has certainly been a trying year but steps have been taken to try and mitigate the production and dispatch times for future projects because of it.

The anticipated parcel containing the replacement models has arrived. I have just unpacked it and they look in excellent condition. Over the coming weekend and early next week I will pack the last of the outstanding pledges and marry then up to any combined pledges from the most recent Terminator armour kickstarter and put them aside. The rest will get grouped up and posted as quickly as possible.
My apologies for the extended delays with this project, and thank you for your continued understanding, its been a tough year for everyone but hopefully things are starting to smooth out a little.

Just touching base that the first of the International pledges from Wave 1 should be starting to arrive in the coming week or two. There is a pretty wide expected delivery window which is understandable considering the state of things atm. However overall they normally get through without much a problem. 
I can confirm that the replacement models for Wave 2 are now in transit to me and, if they follow the pattern from last time, should arrive in a couple of weeks. For those of you in Wave 2 who are also pledging in the most recent project for Savage Pattern armour sets, I can combine postage if you want me to as most of the models should be arriving around the same time. If this is something you would like to do just get in touch with me and I will mark it on your entry in the fulfillment spreadsheet I use.

Just a very quick notice to those international backers in the first wave, the parcels have just been picked up by the courier and will begin their journey to you from Australia. Most of the anticipated delivery dates are ranging from 19th of August to 7th of September, as always these will be quite fluid based on the isolation restrictions in the respective countries at the time the parcels hit their shores.
Cheers

Hi all,
I'm quit a bit relieved to let you know that the replacement models from the damage/lost shipment are nearly completed by the caster and will be shipped to me in the very near future. As soon as they arrive I will take some time off my regular work and get the last of the pledges packaged up and ready for distribution.
The international portion of the first large wave is just waiting for the international courier to pickup and begin distribution of those. It was supposed to happen Monday, however Melbourne is in the midst of a large scale lock down at the moment and courier pickups are getting impacted city wide. As soon as they are picked up from the distribution point I will let you know.

well after the excitement of getting the first shipment and commencing packing i was doubly excited to get a delivery notification of the second package with the rest of the models to complete fulfilment.... until i got home to see the package.

Hi all,
Packing is progressing, I anticipate that I should have as many pledges packed as I have models to fulfill them with by the end of the week. I will let you all know what pledge number I got up to before I ran out of the first shipment, second one is already on its way but again, it could take a month or more to get through postage I'm afraid.
As a bit of compensation for the extended delay, I will be including a free booster pack of the AUS30K collector cards in each pledge. These are packs of 12 random cards from a collection of 100 which feature fan art of the Warhammer 30K/40K universe. The artwork is shown on the front of the card along with a short bio on the reverse along with the artists credit and their website for you to check out more of their work.

Well finally some good news! This weekend I will be going through and sorting the models into packing clusters and trying to get ready for the shipping of everyone's goodies. I would anticipate that I am still at least a week or two away from getting the first lot into the post, but once that happens it will be a relatively straight forward process.
For Australian domestic backers, your parcels will be sent directly to you from Canberra.
For international backers, your parcels will be sent via a bulk courier run, which is how we were able to keep the postage costs low. They will be packaged up and then sent to the dispatch point where the onforwarding courier will collect and begin distribution. Normally this process takes between 7-10 days.
