campaign.story:
Welcome to the Kickstarter campaign for Goregasm Arena - A Brutal Blood Sport in a Weird Wasteland! With your help I will bring my new game to your tabletop. 
Goregasm arena is a game of fast paced gladiatorial combat for 2 - 4 players, set in the crazy Post-Nuclear world of Wasteman. 
You can download the rulebook for free here 
In the desolate future desperate times call for desperate entertainment! Goregasm Arena pits the hardiest denizens of the nuclear wastelands in brutal gladiatorial combat. Strike, shunt, and tackle the competition into submission, asserting your dominance of the alter square in this fast and brutal game. Wrestle for the adoration of the crowd by stomping your opponents into a bloody pulp and reap the rewards (or lament the disastrous consequences) when you spin the wheel. Will you claim the glory in the arena?
Players take it in turns to control miniature combatants, spending adrenaline to perform actions such as strikes, shunts, and tackles in an attempt to gain glory points and whittle down their opponents meat points. Adrenaline only regenerates slowly, so players must be careful not to be caught out after an epic bout of athletic prowess! 
Scream with delight while your foes squeal with pain as they draw awfully brutal injury cards as a result of your critical strikes!
Combatants will inevitably be called to face the crowd with the wheel, where the unpredictable nature of their fans comes to life with fantastic bonuses or treacherous hazards.    
Each box of Goregasm arena comes with the following:
The Miniatures - 35mm scale cast in high quality Resin. Supplied unpainted.
 4 Combatant miniatures and 4 Totems, cast in gorgeous high quality resin. Each miniature is supplied unpainted and in a single piece. 
16 Page, wonderfully illustrated A5 rule book
1 Arena Game board 
1 Spinner wheel
4 Large Tracker cards
28 Injury mini cards
4 Signature mini cards
12 Tracker tokens (design to be confirmed)
4 10-sided dice
  Arena Board and Glory Trackers
The Wheel, Injury cards, Signature cards, and dice
Here are some great add ons to enrich your Goregasm experience!
To add these to your reward simply add the amount shown in the corresponding swag bag image to your pledge. Please add the funds to your pledge during the campaign. Shortly after the kickstarter has finished I will send a survey to find out which specific sets you wanted.

campaign.story:
Welcome to Litchmyre Dungeon, the home of a new range of detailed resin and metal fantasy miniatures, which ooze nostalgia and classic goodness. Zealot is back with our third Kickstarter, bringing to life this new range, with our usual reputation for quality and jaw-droppingly detailed miniatures.
Back in 2014 we created a new level of Dungeon scenery, using digital production methods and detailed vacuum casting. Then last year, we breathed new life into a too-long forgotten fantasy race, the Minotaurs, which we are finishing the delivery of now - with delighted backers praising the detail and quality.
This time, we wanted to go back to our roots and tackle real heroes and villains, characters which capture our imaginations and make us remember why we started gaming or collecting.
We are heavily inspired by classic RPG games; playing old fantasy games from the 80s is what started all this madness in the first place!
So welcome to a fusion of past and present, new and old. We are updating, modernizing and offering to you, this range of high quality miniatures traditionally sculpted by the awesome miniature artist, Boris Woloszyn.
If you like what you see; Read on, brave adventurer.
 We don't produce board game counters, these are not PVC pencil toppers, injection moulded in china  - we make Miniatures. Resin and Metal, these are produced the same as they were 30 years ago, cutting no corners and not skimping on quality or detail. It's not the fastest or cheapest process, but it certainly is the best. If you want Miniatures which you will cherish and still want to use in another 30 years time, then these are for you.
 We have teamed up with Boris Woloszyn, a traditional putty sculptor from Brazil, these models are made by hand, no 3D printing involved (unusually for us!). Boris has a real talent as an artist, able to bring true character to each sculpt, I'm sure you will agree.
These models are heavily inspired by the classic games we grew up loving and playing with our families and friends. Just take a look at the greens, all made from putty.
Production of Boris's sculpts is done in three materials, Standard Resin, White Metal and Premium Resin. As we unlock each material in the stretch goals, you will have a choice to add which material you want.
Standard Resin is one for the gamer, it is on par with a lot of other companies' resin materials, the details are good but the resin is not as tough and flexible as the Premium offering. There will be more splits and parts for each model when they are produced in this material.
White Metal, that fabled shiny material which is fondly remembered by older gamers. When your army weighed more than a cinder block and dropping a Dragon model on your toes resulted in a trip to the hospital.
It's for the gamer or painter who wants a shot of nostalgia, feeling the weight in their hands. The details are good, the models are tough and it paints well. White metal does have more gates and vents to clean up from the model than resin models.
Premium Resin is really a superior resin. It requires very few gates and vents, has a nice matte surface to paint, has 0.2% shrinkage and captures every detail of the original sculpt perfectly. It is tougher than Standard Resin with some flex to avoid damage. It cuts and files well when cleaning the model up or converting.
Premium resin is the material for the serious painter or collector.
 All of the pledges you can supplement with "Add Ons" from the section below.
Miniatures come in three tiers 'Hero Sized', 'Mighty Sized' and 'Monstrous Sized'. Green, Blue and Yellow Dots respectively.
Scenery by our friends at Manor House Workshop, Forgotten Halls
You can add to your pledge with any of the following packs. Just increase your pledge by the amount needed.
To see each scenery piece in better detail, you can view them in our store by clicking here.
Here is a gallery for each of the core Miniatures, stretch goal models can bee seen in the section below. The coloured dot on each image, indicates if they are "Hero Sized", "Mighty Sized" or "Monstrous Sized".
Each model will come with a standard Plastic Round Base or Classic Rectangle base, as shown in the pictures. You can make your selection on the Pledge Manager after the campaign closes.
Scenery by our friends at Manor House Workshop, 3DBases
 As funding progresses we will unlock stretch goals and extra miniatures. Below you can see what has been unlocked and what is the next goal coming up. The coloured dot on each image refers to the size. Green "Hero Size", Blue "Mighty Size" and Orange "Monstrous Size".
We are splitting the production into three tiers with the three types of material on offer. This should allow us to deliver to our deadlines as the load on each manufacturing method is reduced. Currently we have marked July 2019 as the delivery for this project. 
Since this is a traditionally sculpted project, Boris requires around 1 week to complete each additional sculpt, depending on how many stretch goals are unlocked, this could take a fair few months for him to complete the sculpting. You cant rush this kind of art!
If this is the case and we hit a lot of the planned stretch goals, we are happy to offer a split dispatch option, where the core models are dispatched early - since they are already in moulds and not far off mass production. There will be no problem delivering core models before the dispatch date.
Then the stretch goal sculpts will follow some months later in wave 2.
Due to the manufacture method of vacuum cast resin and spincast metals, dispatch date will depend a lot on amount that we fund. We will update this section once funding is underway and we have a better idea for how popular this will be. We do dispatch on a rolling backer ID system.
It may be possible to dispatch Standard Resin core miniatures ahead of the predicted delivery date.
Scenery by our friends at Manor House Workshop, 3DBases
MAXIMUM Postage Costs
These are the MAXIMUM postage costs for a large pledge. For example a pledge of 50 models in White metal would be these values. 50 models in resin, the postage is around half these values.
Postage costs start at the values which are stated on each pledge (£3 UK, £4 EU and £5 Rest of World) If you add more models and Add ons, postage costs will increase with weight. The end postage will be calculated by the pledge manager after the campaign end.
Please note, metal models are around 4 times as heavy as resin.
The end postage costs will be calculated on the Pledge Manager, but they will not exceed the postage values in the table below. These include tracked and signed for shipping.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We will produce a new range of quality resin and metal Heroes and Monsters. The risks to this project are very minimal. We do this kind of production, every day for 8 years, producing miniatures for many high profile companies. All the core set of models are already ready to start mass manufacture. 

We are not new to Kickstarter; our first Kickstarter was a colossal project ~200k resin cast pieces.
We delivered it and it was highly praised that "the quality was beyond amazing" and the detail was "phenomenal". Certainly achieving what we set out; to bring a new level of cutting edge dungeon scenery to gamers.
Our second project, the Minotaur Horde, we are on track to deliver the last few hundred backers inside the next 2 months, and again the feedback was overwhelmingly positive by everyone receiving their pledge. 

Risk#1: Speed of manufacture.
Resin and Spincast Metal are labor intensive materials to cast with. If there are many stretch goals which we hit, then Boris will need more time to sculpt them. This will push back the start of manufacture. 

While there will be no problem delivering the core models by the estimated date. If the project funds well and many goals are hit - then we will offer a split shipping option, so core models are delivered on time, then stretch goal models get delivered in a wave 2 a few months later. 

Aside from the risk of delayed dispatch of stretch goals, the risks are very minimal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
WHO DOESN'T LOVE ORCS AND GOBLINS RIGHT? 
 Those ever present mischievous murderous little rascals and their big stupid brutish cousins go a'rampaging all over the Auld World just often enough that adventurers always have something to do and always show up in significant numbers that your heroes get a good muscle building / skill developing song worthy workout in the process. And these heroes really NEED some awesome enemies to fight right? After all what is a hero without a worthy foe? Tooooo right! NOT VERY MUCH!!
RED BOX GAMES makers of finely detailed, exquisitely designed and expertly sculpted 28 mm traditional western fantasy miniatures presents;
And here they are all gussied up and ready to smash bash and thrash fool hearty would be adventurers painted by Sebastin Picque at DEad Fish Painting with pics granted by the very generous collector who commissioned them from Seb. You can check out more of Seb's awesome body of work on facebook at https://www.facebook.com/DeadFishPainting/?ref=br_rs
  SCALE REFERENCE PICTURE!!!!
   pictured below from left to right RBG Orc, Reaper Orc ( sculpted by me as well ) and a GW Orc ( which wasn't sculpted by me but maybe might have liked to have been )
 Hey look at that!!
   With your generous support and encouragement we hope to fund the production of a boxed set of fearsome beasties fit to harrow your favorite adventuring heroes in primeval forests old and dark and shadowy dungeons dark and deep. 
    Amoungst these burly brutes and sneaky scamps you'll find;
    2 modular Orc Warriors fitted for universally interchangeable legs ( 2 ) right hands with sword or axe ( 2 ) left hands with weapon or shield ( 2 ) and helmeted heads ( 2 ) repeated TWICE for a total of  4 modular figures
    2 Modular Orc Brutes fitted for universally interchangeable legs ( 2 ) bared heads ( 2 ) and weapon options Sword or Mace ( 2 )  repeated TWICE for a total of 4 modular figures.
    2 Runty Goblin Archers cast in a single piece with short bows at the ready repeated TWICE for a total of 4 figures.
    2 Runty Goblin Spearmen cast in a single piece with crudely wicked Spears ready to puncture adventurers repeated TWICE for a total of 4 figures.
     2 Runty Goblin Warriors cast in a single piece with battered rusty swords just perfect for cleaving and cutting hapless passers by! Repeated TWICE for a total of 4 figures.
     All this in one box for the low low price of $40.00 USD! 
     We ALSO have Orcs only Horde boxes where in you will find 16 Orc bad asses just FROTHING at the maw to rend and slash, and bash and smash for the super awesome price of just $40.00 USD
     Aaaaaand cause yall asked for it!! A Goblins only horde box where in you will find 24 of the filthy little rapscallions gnawing on each other's ears and licking their blades and just generally being a writhing mass of stinking pelt bound meanness ready to be unleashed upon those picturesque little hamlets a-scatter in your storybook la-la land. Also for JUST $40.00 USD.
     See? Not much math stuff, lots of Orcs and Goblins. Who needs them book learnin talkie times anyways? Not Gobbers and Orcsies don't.
     It is our hope that as the campaign progresses we can add items to the offering and perhaps to the initial box contents as well HOWEVER as this is our first effort in plastic manufacturing we want to be sure we are responsible and take this slowly keeping everything nice and predictable and efficiently produced and delivered. So there will only be a few additions to this campaigns. We don't want to get too ahead of ourselves with promises but we also want to make sure we make the most of this campaign that we can. You CAN NOT go wrong with more and more monstrous beasties eh?

    Please be aware you can buy as many of these boxes as you want! Personally I don't think any orc or goblin warband is complete unless it nearly breaks the shelves under it's ponderous weight when stowed away between sessions of rampaging blood thirst. 
   If you want to add to your rewards you can do so by managing the amount of your pledge upward by enough to cover the addition of as many green hellions your heart desires. 
  And remember a forest without goblins under every hedge is just not a forest worth trodding through for any self respecting adventurer! And what would goblins do once they DID grab the attention of those hapless Adventuring jerks without their trusty overgrown and significantly less intelligent cousins the Orcs! Big hulking murderous brutes just FROTHING at the mouth to rip into a nice shiny suit of plate mail to get to the squishy red gooey center!!!
  HEY! Yes. YOU! You want to look TOTALLY awesome?! of course you do. ESPECIALLY when looking awesome means wearing a truly kick ass Face of the Orc God T-shirt. No stupid logo. Just an awesome Cave drawing of a screaming horned savage Beastie who strikes fear into the hearts of all who cross his path. You too can borrow a bit of that thunder. Just buy this T-shirt. Wear it proudly. When people ask you where you got that piece of awesomeness Growl! Laugh! Maybe slap yourself in the face a few times and beat your chest and say YOU are a proud contributor to the Red Box Games Hordes of the Auld World Orcs and Goblins kickstarter campaign!
  available in men's sizes S M L XL XXL XXXL XXXXL and XXXXXL
  Want one? All you need to do is add $25.00 to your pledge and you too can look totally awesome in command of your Orcses and Gobbers!
  Your characters are heroes! MIGHTY adventurers! They DESERVE awesome enemies to fight! the theatre of your imagination DESERVES fantastic minis! YOU. NEED. THE HORDES OF THE AULD WORLD ORCS AND GOBLINS BOXED SET!!
   The whole idea of this kickstarter is to fund the production of these fantastic monstrosities in high detail hard grade PVC plastic similar to many of the newly beloved board games recently hitting the market like a spiked ball of steel in the gnarly green fist of a feral Orc berserker rampaging through the ranks of silly tights wearing doods who spend all their time preening their poofy feathered hats and shining their armor and dancing with their little swishy poke " swords " and singing songs about damsels and wine and stupid stuff. Do we really want those kinds of doods in charge of stuff and ruining our good time? No. No we do not. We want Orcs and goblins. Lots of them. That is why plastic is good; cause we can make a LOT of them and sell them cheap.

  So to help us do this well we need your help to allow us to pay the high cost of plastic production with tried and true manufacturers who have produced many of these exact same great boxed game projects.
   Ok this is serious. Shipping is important and can be costly depending upon where in the world you need your stuff to be delivered to. Because we do not know exactly when the project will complete production we cannot bill for postage until the product is actually in hand and ready to deliver. We are working to build a base frame of reference for the shipping costs and we are also working to establish relationships that may allow us to ship from hubs in various parts of the world to mitigate those costs.

And Say! If you like all this snazzy artwork we have here you should check out Dave's artwork over on his facebook page https://www.facebook.com/Zhu-Industries-765057203635151

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My name is Tre Manor. I have been in the miniatures industry since 2006 launching my own business in 2008. I have a significant amount of experience in producing resin and metal figures having produced some 300 odd figures over the past 10 years of being in business for myself. I also have a good deal of experience running and delivering on kickstarters having run and delivered successfully on 11 of them since 2012. I DO NOT however have any experience in the production of plastic miniatures. I have never dealt directly with Chinese production firms nor handled the importation of goods from China. However I AM in contact with competent advisors on these subjects and I have contacts and quotes from reliable and proven Chinese manufacturing firms who have a proven record for delivery and professional service and exemplary quality.

All of that said there are aspects of both production and delivery that go wrong in the production of plastic miniatures and the importation there of. Delays in production, delays in shipment, delays in customs. All of these can be factors in the course of the fulfillment of the campaign as well as changes in the actual product as it goes through the process of plastic production.

We will be actively working to insure this campaign runs as smoothly as possible and that the product delivered is a quality product.

You as a backer need to bear in mind though that by pledging your support to this campaign you are taking on a degree of risk that the end product may be different than the product shown in the campaign or that delivery may take longer than projected. We will always work to be sure you are as satisfied as we are able to but we cannot offer refunds once the funding for the campaign is secured post kickstarter. If you pledge to this campaign you are here by acknowledging that you accept that we cannot offer refunds of pledges.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
It's been a hell of a ride!
Welcome, welcome, one and all, to the first ever Warp Team Fantasy Football Kickstarter! 
WTFF is a brand new range of unique and distinctive miniatures to use in your Fantasy Football games. Each model has been hand sculpted, and is cast in the finest white metal and resin. My goal is to make sure that every single WTFF miniature is packed full of character, is a joy to paint, and will look suitably splendid on your table top.
So grab your popcorn, break out your beverages, and take your seats. Whilst we wait for the match to start, how's about we look at our first plucky team to take to the pitch...
Cast in Metal (TEAM PLAYER) or Fine Resin (GOLDEN BOOTS)
Add any of the miniatures in the Team to your pledge
Human model is for size comparison only and is owned by Games Workshop
 Ram Raiders review by The Wargamer Viking
 Why are there only a few stretch goals?  
Kickstarter is an interesting beast, as all of us know from experience. Countless times people get involved in long, extensive campaigns only to wait months, sometimes years for them to be fulfilled. When the crowd bays for more, it's tempting to give in and offer far more products than you can deliver in the time frame promised at the start of the campaign!
In the past I've ran a few of those types of campaigns, and this time I have decided to keep it short and sweet. This means fewer products for you all to buy, but a much shorter time for you all to wait before your lovely models are on your painting desk. Which we can all agree, is exactly where they ought to be.
Kickstarter Launch Hangout!
The cost of shipping is not included in your pledge, and will be added after the conclusion of the campaign through the pledge manager. I will provide you all with full instructions when the time comes.  
I am still finalising the exact shipping costs, but to give you a rough idea here are a couple of preliminary estimates:
GAME DAY TICKET: - £0 unless used to purchase miniatures in the campaign.
MICKEY'S PICK: - £2 to the UK, £4 EU and £4 ROW.  
TEAM PLAYER/GOLDEN BOOTS: £3.50 to the UK, £7 EU and £7 ROW.  
These estimates may increase if you purchase a large number of additional models on top of your core pledge, especially at the MICKEY'S PICK or DAY TICKET level.
The final shipping costs are subject to change, and will be based on your location and specific rewards.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Any undertaking of this nature is a huge commitment and a lot of work for everyone involved. Miniatures need sculpting, manufacturing, packing and eventually shipping to the backers.

It is at these hurdles that some Kickstarters have faltered in the past, so, I have given careful consideration to each part of the process to minimise potential risk. Warploque Miniatures is a family run business, so everyone involved is 100% dedicated to making this project as successful and professional as possible. My father is our resin caster, my mother is in charge of packing and shipment, and our metal caster is a tried and tested person we have worked with before.

Also, instead of relying purely on concept art and work-in-progress sculpts to illustrate my products, all of the initial models that I am offering have already been sculpted. They've been cast, the display copies have been painted, and they are ready to go into production, so backers know exactly what they are investing in.

To ensure the campaign runs smoothly I will be working on it full-time, and will ensure that all your questions will be answered and updates will posted at all hours.

Finally, I have set achievable delivery date estimates. I have kept the campaign small and manageable, eschewing the long list of stretch goals that other campaigns have had, so this project has a much higher probability of being completed and delivered on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
»Trüberbrook« is a thrilling mystery-sci-fi adventure game for Windows, Mac, Linux, PlayStation®4, Xbox One & Nintendo Switch

Imagine yourself on a vacation to Europe in the late sixties. Now, picture yourself as a young American scientist; Hans Tannhauser. Yes, that’s your name in this scenario. While you’re at it, think of Trüberbrook, a remote village in rural, mountain-sloped and densely forested cold-war Germany. Because, that’s where you somehow end up after hitting the continent. But who cares, you won the trip in a lottery! Or at least, that’s how it seems. But don’t fear, instead of getting some rest, you could find yourself having to save the world …
Attention: All of our sceneries are hand-crafted!
  Suspense! Mystery! Thrills! After all, it's a single player sci-fi mystery adventure game. We want to keep you entertained!
Join American student Tannhauser, stranger in a strange land
Set in cold-war rural Germany in the late 1960s
Inspired by Twin Peaks, The X-Files, Stranger Things & Star Trek
Indulge in universal themes such as love, friendship, loyalty, self-discovery and dinosaurs
Handmade miniature scenery!
English and German localization with full voice acting!
Atmospheric, moody soundtrack
Coming to Windows, Mac, Linux, Xbox One, PlayStation®4 & Nintendo Switch
A likely mobile port later!
Up to 10 hours of super exciting gameplay!
Release scheduled for late 2018 – not the longest wait!
     The year is 1967. The world policy is dominated by the Cold War and Vietnam, Russia and America are racing to the moon. At the same time in Europe, students take to the streets from Paris to Berlin.
On a larger scale, the world is locked in turmoil, but most people are unaware of the events unfolding in an overlooked, sleepy part in the German province. Hans Tannhauser, an American student in his late twenties is caught by surprise: Out of the blue, he wins a trip to a small, German village, Trüberbrook. Truber-what? No idea! It doesn’t help he can’t remember taking part in any lottery in the first place … Happy to put some distance between him and his Ph.D. in quantum physics, he makes his way to Trüberbrook, Germany, bursting with curiosity.
But shortly after his arrival, inexplicable things start to happen: A mysterious stranger breaks into his room at the Guesthouse Waldeslust and steals a paper on physics. But who would do that? And why?
Gradually, he gets to know the various villagers and spa guests, one more peculiar than the other. Only young anthropologist Gretchen Lemke, who is on a research trip to Trüberbrook, seems normal to him. Before he knows it, Gretchen becomes Tannhauser’s accomplice on the adventure of a lifetime! It slowly dawns on the aspiring physicist that his presence in Tüberbrook is not accidental – he is here to save the world!
As the story proceeds, Tannhauser teams up with Gretchen Lemke, a student of paleoanthropology, and bumps into the enigmatic inventor Lazarus Taft.
The ensemble (more detailed sketches down below)
  Tannhauser is an American physics student in his mid-twenties – and a clever one at that. The adorable little fellow is well-read, always curious and of a deeply friendly nature.
 Tannhauser is played by Justin Beard:
Gretchen Lemke was always the fiercest kid in the sandbox; cute but merciless if someone dared interrupting her excavations of twig bones and toy artefacts. The somewhat overenthusiastic student of paleoanthropology arrives in Trüberbrook on an adventure to unravel the mysteries surrounding the village.
Gretchen Lemke is played by Nora Tschirner:
As much a reclusive inventor as it gets, Lazarus Taft quickly became talk of the town due to his superior card playing. There must be a reason he bought this costly old mansion in Trüberbrook, of all places … What's up with Lazarus Taft?
Lazarus Taft is played by Dirk von Lowtzow:
Trüberbrook is full of quirky villagers, tourists and strangers – like the gruffy but warm-hearted innkeeper Trude or her daughter Leni, "the weird kid" from Trüberbrook Elementary. And there's the old baron, a veteran of two world wars, or Lessing, the prototype of modern day conspiracists. And of course Trübi, the legendary lake monster. To name a few.
One of the most distinctive features of the game is the unique visual style. The sceneries are purely handmade. 'Handmade' as in: 'Manufactured using real hands!' And fingers!
Not the most efficient way of doing things, but certainly the most inefficient one. We're loving it, though! Look at what we do here, piece by piece, by the sweat of our brows. Every little detail is custom-made.
The models are digitized using a technique called photogrammetry and later retopologized. This way we get highly detailed polygon models that blend perfectly with our digital characters.
It is a lot of work, but also quite exciting! You may ask yourself, how can they reach this level of detail? Are there very tiny people involved? They can't accomplish all of this with mere human hands, right? Well yes, we can! The answer might be our abundance of professional hands. Twenty-four seven at our disposal in all shapes and colors, they get things done!
Weather effects, using real lights
Every scene gets an individual treatment and is staged with actual physical lighting. This allows us to simulate different hours of the day or weather conditions. Even a change of seasons is possible just by redecorating the set with real tiny little snowflakes, no joke.
Different hours of the day
This way we achieve an exceptional and magical look that visually reflects the world of Trüberbrook.
Technical breakdown of a scene
  Collective childhood hero Ron Gilbert inspecting our models while on promotion for "Thimbleweed Park"
      Trüberbrook is a story-driven adventure game with a strong focus on characters and the narrative, but includes a lot of puzzles that need to be solved to progress the story. The puzzles are designed to integrate into the narrative.
Interaction with the environment
You navigate Tannhauser through the different sceneries from a third person perspective, usually in long distance shots to intensify the impression of peeking into a little diorama. The story unfolds as you interact with your environment, talk to other characters and solve puzzles. These range from inventory-based puzzles to social challenges (such as persuading other characters) up to passing unsettling psycho tests.
Extensive dialogue trees
For the console versions, we came up with a very intuitive controller input, allowing you to move the line of sight and walking directions independently. For the PC versions, you can choose between classic point and click mouse controls, and the controller navigation. 
  The soundtrack of Trüberbrook is an original composition to fit the mood of the game – sort of a tranquil "doom jazz". Inspirations come from the works of Tom Waits, Angelo Badalamenti, Mark Lanegan, Timber Timbre or Bohren & der Club of Gore.
The soundtrack has a playtime of around 40 minutes and is directed by Sebastian Nagel & Albrecht Schrader. Why not listen to the serene main theme while browsing the project?
–– Please note that there's an additional fee for shipping and packaging on all the physical rewards. It will be applied on checkout and depends on your country. ––
We prepared some nice rewards for your support. Here are some details:
Regular Digital Version: The regular digital version of the game comes for Windows, Mac and Linux (all DRM-free or via Steam, your choice) and for PlayStation®4, Xbox One or Nintendo Switch (all via their respective stores). If the game is successfully funded, we'll contact you so you can tell us which version you'd prefer. You can also add additional copies (for a friend or for another system) to your reward by adding 25€ (or $29) to your pledge.
Early Access Version: The early access version of the game comes for Windows, Mac and Linux. Enjoy the game while there are no walkthroughs and letsplays around – unless you create them yourselves, which we'd like to encourage! For organizational reasons, this version is limited and will be distributed via Steam. It will be ready around ten days before the regular release!
PC Boxed Version: This boxed version is exclusive to Kickstarter and includes a physical disc to install the game DRM-free on your Windows, Mac or Linux system. Also comes with an additional Steam Key and includes some really nice haptic goodies, such as a manual and stuff. You can add additional boxes to your reward by adding 75€ (or $87) to your pledge, packaging and shipping included.
PS4 Boxed Version: New! This boxed version is exclusive to Kickstarter and includes a PS4 version of the game. Comes with some really nice haptic goodies, such as a manual and stuff. You can add additional boxes to your reward by adding 75€ (or $87) to your pledge, packaging and shipping included.
Art Book: The art book is one of our favourite rewards, since, you know, we have tons of artwork, sketches and behind-the-scenes material to share with you! The digital version will be available as a DRM-free download. It is included in the digital plus edition and all higher tiers or can be added to a lower tier by adding 12€ (or $14) to your pledge! The really neat printed version is a Kickstarter exclusive item and rather expensive to produce. Every copy will be numbered continuously and signed by the team. You can add more printed art books by raising your pledge by 59€ (or $69).
Digital Wallpapers: The lower tiers include one random (1 out of 5) digital wallpaper in a 5k resolution. The whole set of 5 digital wallpapers is included in the digital plus edition and all higher tiers. Can also be added to lower tiers by raising your pledge by 6€ (or $7).
Digital Soundtrack: The digital soundtrack is included in the digital plus edition and all higher tiers. It will be available as a DRM-free download. You can also add it to lower tiers by adding 15€ (or $18) to your pledge!
Your name in the credits: We would be happy to put your real name into the credits. Of course you can also provide us with a pseudonym.*
Your name featured in the game: The higher tiers include the really cool opportunity to immortalize your name in the genetic code of the game. Could be in the hotel's guestbook, a book title in the library or in the patient manifesto of the sanatorium ... There will be different prominent spots throughout the game for you to leave your name! *
Your Portrait: As in every decent guesthouse, there's a small ancestral gallery of regular visitors ("Stammgäste") at the Waldeslust. We have reserved a unique spot for the most willing backers, awaiting your portrait to join in! Our character artist Benny will draw your likeness in the style of the game – or at least he will try to! For that, he will need some photos provided by you to meet your appearence. Take a look at our own team portraits below to get the idea! As a bonus feature, there will be a short biographical note* included for these sparkling personalities, of course commented by the main character.
* Please keep in mind that every submission or pseudonym needs to meet community standards: no racist, sexist or otherwise offensive pseudonyms and submissions will be accepted, also no copyright infringing material. We reserve the right to reject a submission for any reason. Thank you for your understanding!
Personal Studio Tour: A personal studio tour of our facilities in Cologne, Germany. Visit our legendary main base "Studio König", probably the only professional and fully functional TV studio made up from scratch and screwed together by a bunch of art students. Here we create our weekly late night show "Neo Magazin Royale" as well as "Schulz & Böhmermann". The tour is guided by the developers of the game and includes an exhibition of the miniature sceneries used in the game. To make the most of it, we suggest a visit on a weekday, so you can get to know all of our collegues in the wild! We are somewhat flexible regarding the date and will contact you on the details once the Kickstarter is over. Attention: travel expenses and accomodation are not included.
Our main base "Studio König" – famous for the lavish Hoppenbrock mural and the impressive triceratops gargoyle on it's roof
Original Set Piece: We have tons of tiny little set pieces used in the making of the actual game. Each and every piece was created individually and received a lot of work, time and love from our set designers. We'll make sure to let you choose between a variety of original set pieces once the campaign is over. Don't worry, there's certainly enough for everyone!
Unique Scenery Scale Model: Our scenery models come in different shapes and sizes – some are reaaally big, like an ankylosaurus, while others are rather small, like a hesperonychus. We are ready to give away one of our smaller models (as the big ones would be far to heavy to transport). Let's be honest here: it will probably break our hearts to see the little ones go. But from the day we brought them into life, we always knew they would want to leave the house one day, become independent, travel the world. So it's cool, really. (We can always make new ones.)
If you'd like to add a specific reward to your selected tier, just add the corresponding amount of money (see list for prices) to your pledge. We'll then check the difference between your selected tier and the actual pledged money and get back to you after the Kickstarter to clarify which rewards you wished to include. Feel free to message us or ask in the comments if you have any questions!
  We'll release the game for Windows, Mac, Linux, Xbox One, PlayStation®4 & Nintendo Switch.
Mobile: Right now we cannot promise mobile versions for Android and iOS, but we think the game would be much fun on tablet computers and mobile phones. We would love to do these after the initial release, as the development would certainly take some extra time due to different technical challenges and performance reasons.
  We've spent a lot of time working on a voice acting concept that joins in with the genetic code of the game. Since the protagonist is an American in the midst of a bunch of Germans, we wanted to reflect this in our choice of actors.
In the international English version, the main character Tannhauser speaks American English, while the townspeople of Trüberbrook sport a (more or less) German accent. In the German version, it's vice versa: the protagonist might have a modest American accent, while the townspeople welcome him in regular German, most likely with a dialect. Both approaches bear a certain degree of entertainment, each in their own way.
We are btf, an interdisciplinary team with expertise in programming, game design, writing, animation, graphic design, sound design and production. The studio emerged in 2012 from a collective of art students in Cologne, Germany. If you are familiar with German television, you might know our late night TV shows »Neo Magazin Royale« or »Schulz & Böhmermann« or our web comedy series »Gute Arbeit Originals«.
As passionate gamers and die-hard adventure game fans, we crave to develop video games. Our first two adventure games were addressed to the audience of our show »Neo Magazin Royale« and in German only, whereas the world of »Trüberbrook« is set in a genuine and independent universe.
Hello!
Our small core team consists of Florian (director and game designer), Lea (the producer), Hans (technical artist), Lea (set designer), Simon (developer) and Benny (the character designer). The team is few and far between reinforced from the nucleus of btf by other artists, animators, designers and programmers.
The first ideas for Trüberbrook date back as far as 2011, but pre-production was only started in 2014, when Florian approached the studio with the concept.
So far, we've managed to cross-finance the development mainly through side projects. To get things started, we received a funding for the game by the Medienboard Berlin-Brandenburg, a regional media development fund. But this will only get us so far, which is why we reach out to you via Kickstarter.
Though the conceptual development is already finished and most of the assets are already prototyped and tested, there is still a long way to go. The money from Kickstarter will mainly be used for the creation of 20 hand-crafted miniature scenery models, for the development in Unity3D as well as for the creation of the many assets needed, like 3D-models, animations and sounds.
How the money will be used
But ... isn't there a publisher involved? Yes, we are happy that the game will be published by our friends at Headup Games, a small but well-known indie label from Germany. As it's a pure distribution deal they don't bring any money at the table and let us keep full creative control over our game.
Lore Items.  When we created the world of Trüberbrook, it's characters and places, we always came up with little backstories for each and every detail. We always thought it would be wonderful and quite enriching to dive into the game if we had the chance to put all these little backstories right into the game. With this stretch goal, we'll fill the world with many little pieces that are basically not important to finish the game, but will give you a better immersion, like newspapers, posters, notes, TV shows, inscriptions, smalltalk dialogue parts and more! We hope you like this goal as much as we do, as it will make the game just more detailed.
Handmade Soundscape. This is something we always wanted to do! We think our handmade environments deserve an equally handmade soundscape. This includes making foley sound effects in the studio as well as field recordings. This stretch goal is also aiming at making the game just better.
New Chapter: The Prologue. This is a big one. We came up with this some time ago and are still looking forward to this: The prologue, a whole new chapter of the game that was already written along with the main story, but didn't make it into the final concept due to financial restrictions. We would still like to add this missing piece to the game somehow. If we reach this stretch goal, we'll create this all new chapter, including new handmade miniature sceneries and new characters, giving you the opportunity to explore a new facette of the storyline. We'll release the prologue exclusively as a stand-alone mini-episode for all our backers first – though it may be available for regular buyers at some later point after the release.
New Chapter: The Interlude. Another new chapter with even more content and more puzzles. We can't talk about the content without spoiling it, but to give you an idea, the interlude will explore a stranger and more bizarre part of the plot, another twist, another turn, a detour, a pocket in subspace that needs to be rediscovered, a new little story to be experienced.
Making-of Video. As already mentioned in the comments, we've stored tons and tons of filmed material on our harddrives. These were originally recorded to be used for the Kickstarter video, which shows but a small fraction of all the stuff we did. We would love to put together a long hands-on making-of video that mainly concentrates on the model making process, spending time with the set designers in the workshop, showing the lighting and camera work and the magical process of photogrammetry. It's going to be techy and nerdy in the raw!
Developer's Audio Commentary: Be it by the set designers, the digital artists, the sound designer or the director – there's an abundance of stories to tell about every little detail in our world as we've spent a lot of time fleshing everything out. The developer's audio commentary (can be switched on and off inside the game menu) will give you the opportunity to take a surreal and wild ride on our train of thought. In the words of Lazarus Taft: "You have to see the whole picture."
To stay tuned and in touch, please visit us at
Facebook
Twitter
Instagram
Website, Newsletter & Devlog
Or take a look at our PRESSKIT!
An old hat for our newsletter subscribers and facebook fans: The Trüberbrook Tribune, the local newspaper from Trübertown. Reseached and written by ambitious Trüberbrookian journalists, the Tribune provides you with the freshest news and most interesting snippets of world lore, interwoven with the town’s rich history, even forboding events that might eventually be happening in the game.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If you're new to Kickstarter: You can support our game by selecting one of the rewards we prepared for you. If we reach our funding goal of 80.000 €, you enable us to develop the game from start to finish in every detail according to our vision. The amount of money you want to spend will only be collected if we reach our goal and you will receive your rewards once the game is released. If we fail to reach our goal though, your account won't be charged at all.

Thanks to a funding by the Medienboard Berlin-Brandenburg and our own crossfinancing through other projects, we were able to already finish a huge part of the game. Some of the most crucial phases lie behind us, like finishing the script, the dialogues and the game design. We've also built the first half of the scenery models and checked out the best workflows for our photogrammetry process. Also, all of the character designs are finished and some of them already modeled, rigged and extensively tested within the scenes. So there's is a good vertical slice – much more than a reliable and strong proof of concept. This was important to us before we even considered to do a Kickstarter, so we could show you a meaningful status of the project. In the months ahead, we want to finish and assemble all the missing parts and pieces according to a carefully fleshed out production plan.

Of course, there can (and most likely will) always be surprises and challenges in the upcoming development. Bad examples: key team members might get ill or the office burns to the ground. Good examples: key team members are having a baby or win a once-in-a-lifetime trip to the moon. No matter what, we are determined to finish the project right on time and as soon as possible!

Ringmaster

Hello everyone, welcome to the Freak Circus!
A collection of bizarre and weird circus characters which were inspired amongst others by shows on television, old pictures seen in books and on the internet. I always had a fascination with these strange quirks of nature and thought it would be cool to do a range of them in miniature form.
The miniatures were sculpted by Radmir Achmentov. A very talented sculptor from Russia. I think he captured the essence of the characters very well and did a really good job! 
We actually had commissioned them a pretty long time ago but they only arrived just recently due to some odd circumstances. Maybe the nature of the subject had something to do with that. But I'm happy that they are finally here and I can present them to you!
We have five (six including the Little Princess) different characters on offer in this campaign and if we do really well then I really hope we get to delve further into the subject matter and get many more Freaks done. I know that I have at least 20 more of them in mind so hopefully those might happen at some point also!
This campaign is pretty straightforward and small. I tried to stay as low as possible with the pricing of the miniatures. Hopefully you'll agree.
As said before we have five (six if you count the Giant & the Little Princess as two) miniatures on offer in this campaign. I've tried to take good pictures of them but the original sculpts proved quite difficult to photograph well due to the dark polymer clays that have been used. That's why I've also made some short video clips of them all which show them in all their glory. You can see these videos at the bottom of the page. I expect that the resin castings will be very smooth and even better looking as they always do.
Onto the stars of the show!
The Ringmaster
The Bearded Lady 
 Two-heads the musician
 The Giant & the Little Princess
 The Mighty Imp
For better views of the miniatures please scroll down for the videos. They show the sculpts quite well but are a bit big! :P
The sizes of each individual miniature are; (from bottom to top)
Ringmaster  45mm
Bearded Lady 52mm
Two-heads 47mm (hunched over)
Giant 70mm & Little Princess 25mm
Mighty Imp 32mm

Mighty Imp & Ringmaster €3,-

The company who handles our shipping proved he does a good job with our last three Kickstarters and shipping in general so we have every faith we can deliver on time once again. We don't think there will be a delay in packages going out to backers but would just like to add that delays can happen. Once the shipping company has your parcels it is out of our control. However we will do everything possible again to fulfill this Kickstarter on time.
Please note that we are not responsible for any customs or other fees that might occur.

updates.update_content:
WOWWW!!! WE MADE IT!!!!
I cannot thank you enough for making this a reality! I'm humbled by your support!!!
There were times where I thought we wouldn't make it. I'll be the first to admit that this campaign was ill prepared in regards to our previous ones! Painful but also a very learn full experience! It had its causes but I should have taken more time. Now that it's funded it does give us the possibility to move forwards and do things better!

Hi all,
Grx has just sent me pictures of the first test castings of the Freak Circus! And… they look amazing!!! I think you'll agree that even these simple photographs show the miniatures much better then the ones we took of the master sculpts!

Hi everyone,
A little less more than half a week remaining and we are over two thirds of the target. Surely we can still make this! If you are planning to support the campaign please do it now so other who might be hesitant will see we will make it! ;)
Here are some close up of some of the details on the sculpts. I mean…MONKEYS!!! And a rabbit!

Two days in and we are half way to our goal! Things are looking good and hopefully we can reach the end line well before the campaign ends!
I'm talking to someone for another painting journal and I'll share more about it futher along in the campaign. I wish I had painted examples already but the minis took such a long time to reach us, that we had to launch the campaign as is. Next time there will finally be painted miniatures, promised!

campaign.story:
Welcome to The Land and the world of Spitfyre, our exciting game of aerial warfare in a fantasy world. Enter a world where Dwarves and Orcs fly giant creatures and arm them with bombs and machine guns to continue their millennia long struggles... Come fight in the skies of Spitfyre and see if you can reign supreme over The Land!
Spitfyre is a fun 'Historo-Fantasy' miniature aerial wargame in which 10mm scale miniatures are used to depict the everyday struggles of standard fantasy races such as Orcs and Dwarves fight out battles with 20th century weaponry.
The Kickstarter has proven much more successful than we anticipated (thanks!) with pledgers funding what we planned for two weeks in a little over two days. Consequently we have added a new pledge level that includes the first planned supplement for Spitfyre!
THE PILOT PLEDGE (FUNDED!)
'Pilot' pledgers receive a discounted copy of the core game and the first FOUR stretch goals added in FREE of charge. The core game includes the rulebook, a flight of three 10mm scale resin Orc Spitfyre wyverns, a flight of four 10mm scale polyurethane resin Dwarf War-Eagles and seven flying bases.
The Pilot Pledge including freebies...
You can try the core rules system here for free...

1 x polyurethane resin 10mm scale Dwarf KampfGeier 87 vulture dive bomber and flying base and the rules will be extended to include dive bombing.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a few potential setbacks in any project, these could be obvious from the start or at the end or when we ship! However, the obvious ones to us now are:

1. 3D Printing - This is now in house so we do not anticipate any problems here.

2. Manufacture of miniatures - This is also now an in house operation and we have many years experience moulding and casting so do not anticipate any problems here .

3. Rules - the rules are written and being typeset. They will be going to print once the Kickstarter is complete.

4. Popularity - we have restricted our stretch goals to what we feel are manageable, even though our imaginations would run riot if allowed to! If the game is a success we will look to expand the model range etc after the Kickstarter is fulfilled.

5. Shipping - International customers (outside of the EU) may encounter unexpected import taxes and/or delays in customs. You can contact your customs department for more information. We are aiming to use UPS, who have a stellar track record.

Throughout this Kickstarter, we will make sure that you guys are communicated with to the best of our ability, to show exactly where we are and exactly where any delays are coming from and how we are tackling them.

I wasn’t expecting to post again quite as quickly and whilst I am not in a position to go into details and I still need to start lining up some ducks, there is some light at the end of the (still) very long tunnel.
A good chunk of the day was spent looking at all the resin moulds with a caster, trying to work out what they were etc. and for the most part they still seem usable (the proof of the pudding will be in the casting but maybe things aren’t quite as bad as I was led to believe). That said they still have a limited life so investigations are underway to see about switching to metal for the KS (apart from the Kondor which would be too heavy in metal). Fingers crossed on this as metal moulds last a lot longer (I still have some over 20 years old that quite happily work).

updates.update_content:
Apologies for the delay in an update, unfortunately I (somehow) managed to tear my retina which necessitated in having emergency laser eye surgery twice and not being able to attend Colours as planned (so that was another pile of money lost on the trade stand we couldn’t use).
As bad news likes company I also found out that the resin miniature moulds I rescued from Hysterical last December were now useless. Apparently these things have a limited shelf life (unlike metal figure moulds), something I wasn’t aware of.
Of course this means that trying to fulfil the Kickstarter is now even harder. When I said I would try and rescue it I was starting from a position of no money. I never received a penny from Hysterical so it wasn’t a case I could use something from them to move things on and despite some decent sales at Crusade and Partizan, the cost of some stock we had cast for Partizan (before the moulds went kaput), the trade stands and the storage costs mean that I’ve been running at an increasing loss for some time now.

Unfortunately nothing to report, still waiting for the bats to be printed and for the Orc Defiant fighter sculpting to be properly started. I am relying on other people here doing this out of the goodness of their hearts as I don’t have the money to fund this.

campaign.story:
Last year, we started a new range of female adventurer miniatures for use in RPGs and tabletop gaming, or simply for painters and collectors. Although there are loads of male miniatures available already, there are a lot less female ones... and they are more often dressed for a swimsuit contest than for serious dungeon-delving!
We decided to sculpt some no-nonsense, sensibly dressed and equipped female adventurers; providing an alternative to all the chainmail bikinis that are so common in tabletop.
Our £1800 goal will go towards paying for the moulding and casting of at least 12 new models. The miniatures will be cast in white metal, and you can see pictures of the master sculpts ('greens', as they are known) further down the page. 
 


Below you'll find pictures of the sculpted miniatures; we'll be adding to them as we go...
PLAY

    'Tabaxi has wares, if you have coin...' No, hang on, wrong game!
They may look gentle, but don't try building a highway through a firbolg's forest...
She's as deadly as she is beautiful... well, beautiful to another hobgoblin, anyway!
Is she a Kenku or an Tengu? Depends on whether she's in D&D or Pathfinder, I guess...
She's a fighter or a barbarian; but she'd make a good rogue swashbuckler too...
You get the five miniatures shown above, and the next seven shown below... 
  She's a noble heroic paladin... or maybe a chaotic evil hell-knight. Could go either way!
Dragonborn - maybe a fighter, a paladin or a cleric?
Another Tiefling - she looks relatively harmless, but I reckon you should expect some dark arts...
                      As well as the Pledge levels, you can add any or all the of the Sensible Shoes miniatures from our previous projects, either as discounted sets, or as individual miniatures.
   
        Oathsworn is the trading name of Jo and Michael Lovejoy; a pair of sculptors, gamers and general scifi fantasy obsessives from the North-east of England. We've been in the industry for many years now, and have run eleven Kickstarter projects; all of which were delivered on time or early.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The main risks are getting the miniatures safely moulded, and then producing enough casts to satisfy demand. 
Thankfully both these problems come down to the skill and experience of the sculptor and the mouldmaker. And we've been doing this for a long time now, with 11 projects all completed, and delivered on time.

In short, we're not expecting any problems, but if we have some, we'll keep you informed, and we'll deal with them professionally.

Hey everyone,
It's Friday night, so I thought we should let you know how we're getting on with shipping out your pledges... as you know, we've been unwell, which slowed us down a bit, but we're right back on track now.

All Backer rewards to Canada, Japan, Kazakhstan, the Philippines, Taiwan, Brazil, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Mexico, the Czech Republic, New Zealand and Australia have been shipped; well, almost all - we're still waiting for some info from one of the Australian Backers.

We're now on with the big one - the USA. There's a lot of parcels going to the USA... but Jo's made a start on packing them, and we'll begin sending them out on Monday.

Hey everyone,
The last couple of weeks have been a bit of a disaster, really. Both of us caught a 'flu virus at the ROBIN wargames show, and ended up pretty well out-of-action as a result. I'm just about OK now, but Jo's still not well.

So that's slowed things down a bit on the fulfillment front...

But it hasn't stopped us completely! The last week has been spent sorting through thousands of miniatures, and bagging them up:

Hey everyone,
We've had a busy weekend. We were trading at the Red on Blue in Nottingham (ROBIN) wargames show... 
The alarm clock went off at 4am on Sunday, and we climbed into the van and set off to the show. A few hours later, we'd arrived, and set up our trade stand:

Hey everyone,
Just a very quick update to let you know that Pete has finished all the production moulds, and is now on with casting the miniatures!
So in two or three weeks, if it all goes well, we should be able to start sorting out your pledges... :)

cheers,
Michael & Jo

Hey everyone,
If you remember the last Update, we were about to make a new master mould for the halfling mastiff-rider; that's been done now, and it's all worked perfectly this time. So Pete's finished the master casting, and is moving on with finishing off the production moulds. He reckons another two weeks and they'll all be completed, tested and ready to use.

I tried taking some photos of the first test casts, but they were very shiny, and didn't show up well. So I've 'blacked' a set with some paint, which means you can see the detail more clearly.

Hey everyone,
Not a lot happening at the moment, thanks to the time of year... Pete's waiting for a delivery of more mould blanks, to continue the production moulding process. They probably won't arrive until the first week in January, thanks to people taking time off work.

Not a lot to say really; so, I thought we'd have a look at some of the things that happen behind the scenes in miniatures production. While we plan as carefully as possible, the production process doesn't always go smoothly... and we've got an example to show you!

When we master moulded the sculpted greens, they all came out fine. But whenever you mould a miniature, you always get a mould line where the two halves of the mould join together. Ideally, you try to make sure this line doesn't run across any critical parts.

On the halfling mastiff-rider, this was a problem... the way she was moulded meant that the mould line ran across her face. This is something we want to avoid. There's a couple of ways to get around it; the first is to re-position the part. Problem is, this also alters the pose of the miniature, and can often spoil it. The other way is to add an extra bit of putty near the mould join, so as to shift the mould line across a bit. The tricky part is to keep it looking good!

This is what we did with the halfling. First I tested it out on one of metal master casts:

Hey everyone,
I just thought we'd post a quick Update to show we're still here... there's not really a lot of news to share though.

Jo's been working her way through the Backer Surveys. We've had most of them returned now; we're only waiting for 21 more. We're using them to work out how many miniatures Pete will need to cast to fulfill the project. Looks like it will be roughly 7000...

So far, the most popular miniature is the Minotaur. 

Pete's currently on with the slow process of turning master castings into production moulds. Once he's done with that, we'll let you know.

campaign.story:
Welcome friends, fans and new readers alike! This is Iron Circus Comics' biggest Kickstarter EVER. We're so thrilled to present The COMPLETE Girls with Slingshots!
Danielle Corsetto's Girls with Slingshots debuted September of 2004, and ran for over 10 years, winning a Reuben Award, publishing thousands of strips, and gaining thousands upon thousands of loyal readers. By the time of the comic's grand finale in March of 2015, GwS was one of the biggest names in online comics, with countless fans visiting daily to read about the lives, loves and adventures of Hazel, Jamie, and their friends.
As the strip's popularity grew,TEN softcover collections were compiled. But after ten years of printing and reprinting, half of the volumes are sold out or hard to find. So, now that GwS has seen its last update, it's time to send this legend of a comic strip off in the collection it deserves.
Curious? Intrigued? New to the strip and wanna try before you buy? You can still read THE WHOLE THING on the Girls with Slingshots website.
  The Complete Girls with Slingshots not only includes every single Girls with Slingshots strip ever uploaded (some with touched-up art!), but a TON of extras, like behind-the-scenes art, creator commentary, and some never-before-seen comics, all in full and glorious color!
As a matter of fact, we've got so much good stuff here that we can't even put it all in one volume! So we're not printing just one volume, but two; approximately 320 pages each, and coming in an incredibly beautiful, foil-embossed slipcase designed by Danielle herself.
We're keeping the rewards simple: just the books; both books with sketches by Danielle; or both books with sketches AND a piece of original art from GwS (sold out!!)!
The Artist's Edition sketches will be lovingly drawn in colored pencil, an upgrade from Danielle's usual quick ink sketches.
The DELUXE Artist's Edition will also include an original strip from the series (Danielle will hand-pick a strip that suits your preferences), or the original art for the covers or slipcase, if you're quick enough to snap it up first!
    This Kickstarter is International-Shipping-Friendly!
Iron Circus Comics is excited to announce that this Kickstarter marks their  very first partnership with Blackbox, a fulfillment company from the folks behind Cards Against Humanity!
What does that mean in practice? That international shipping costs for this project will be much lower than we've ever been able to offer before, by as much as 85%. Blackbox manages this by shipping individual orders from other nations, reducing taxes and fees significantly.
Check out out backer levels and see our new shipping fees for yourselves!
Promo video created by Matt Sheridan and Danielle Corsetto.
All art by Danielle Corsetto
"Golden Sparkle Transition" by Azmara
"Transitions All-in-One" by AvidEditor
"Rock Together" by SionSounds
Assorted sound effects from Freesound
 ***JUST ADDED: Stretch Goal!***
We weren't going to do any, but I figured it couldn't hurt to aim high and offer something that a *LOT* of people have been requesting: a pull-out insert of the rules to Strip Drunk Scrabble! 
If we hit $300k, every book will include a copy of the rules that you can remove and keep inside your Scrabble box. (PDF peeps, we can just send you the PDF of it!) Danielle will take immense pleasure in play-testing the game again to make sure the rules are still solid, wwwwink.

Hey, all. Spike here. Long time, no chat!

Everlasting Wet Palette: A must have for miniature painters
Painting Zombies, orks, robots and all kind of monsters from a nightmare can be a lot of fun ! To paint miniatures, you need a Wet Palette to keep your paint moisturised. Today there is no straight forward solution on the market. That's why we created Everlasting Wet Palette, with best in class hydration system and easy to use and to carry airtight case. 
It's actually so good that it is approved by Pro Painters all around the world
With Everlasting Wet Palette, you will save your acrylic paint, save your time and be able to master painting techniques like a pro. Stand back, relax and focus on what's important: enjoying your painting sessions.
Because acrylic paint dry really really fast! So fast, you can't even take a short break or perform advanced techniques !  Everlasting wet palette is a must-have to enjoy your painting session :
Save paint: the paint won't dry out during your painting session
Start and stop at will: you can stop painting for a few minutes, hours or days, and find again workable paints when you come back
Achieve advanced technics: thanks to Everlasting stable hydration system, and our smooth surface, you will be able to perform advanced technics like Glaze, Gradients, Blending, 2 Brush Blending
And it's easy to use: it works straight out of the box, and the case, wells and brush holders were designed for your to enjoy your miniature painting!
Painter (5,9" x 7,9"): easy to store and carry, small to medium working space

Your paint dilution will stay stable during your painting session for hours. The paint will not bleed and will not dry. The perfect hydration will help you master the painting techniques like a pro. This cannot be reproduced without our paper and foam.

All this right out of the box
Our foam holds a lot of water compared to its size ! The final foam will be thicker than the one used during reviews and reaches 3.5mm for improved hydration while retaining the same quality.
Our special foam is naturally mold resistant. No anti-mold chemicals are added to the foam, and the effect will not wear out over time. So no bad smell after a few days, even when not stored in a fridge. Long lasting, you just need to rinse it from time to time with fresh water.
Our paper is the perfect match for our foam. It sticks on it, and does not create bubbles. 100% of the paper is in contact with the foam, for perfect hydration. It will not curl after the easy setup. It was particularly selected to offer the best performance with hobby paints and level of dilution used in hobby painting.
Machine cut to exact dimensions, taking into account the swell effect due to the water contact

We designed Everlasting Wet Palette with perfect dimensions :
For easy access. 
Low raise
Compact foot print.
2 sizes are available to cater to different needs : 
Painter size, 15 by 20 cm (5,9" x 7,9"), made for miniature painters looking for a good sized palette, that is compact and easy to carry. It's perfect for small to medium sized paint stations. Painter Everlasting Wet Palette can be extended using the top lid as a side Palette.
Studio size, 20 by 30 cm (7,9" x 11,8"), made for Pros and Enthusiasts looking for a huge painting area. It's perfect for medium to large sized paint stations. Studio Everlasting Wet Palette can also be extended using the top lid as a side Palette.

Airtight, and leak resistant. We selected a TPE seal for its durability and so that it is easily operable.

Finally, we selected strong, high quality ABS plastics for its durability and stability.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We worked hard to bring the utmost quality at the best cost to our backers during the design and planning stage. We worked with 3D printed models, reviewed suppliers, samples and involved amateurs and professional painters to ensure product fit and efficiency. We are proud of the results and we now want to make sure to deliver it to you timely and as intended.

The main risks are concentrated in the production and delivery stages. Drawing on our extensive experience in driving large projects we took the following measures to mitigate any risks. 

For the production stage, we rely only on suppliers with expertise and appropriate production capacity in their fields :
- Wet palette enclosure and air tight cover: Best expertise for this type of product is in Asia. From experience, to secure the sourcing and production, we will rely on a seasoned and specialised Taiwan based procurement manager. This will ensure quality, timely delivery of the product and that we can meet CE environmental and work standards. 
- Advanced Foam and hydration paper : We identified several suppliers with adequate production quality. The main issue here will be to control the exact cut size as both the foam and the paper tend to expend when wet and retract when drying. 

For logistics, we planned the sourcing flows from factories. The complexity will then depend on backers volume by region. We will set up regional hubs if needed to optimise delivery. However some remote regions might experience slightly increased delays depending on local regulations or customs requirements.

For non miniature hobby painter interested in our product, we have selected and tested the product to work best with hobby paint and dilution used in hobby painting. We could not test all artistic paints available, and results could vary.

(c) Luo Yang, Beijing Couple, 2011
LUO YANG_GIRLS
This book comprises the most beautiful, disturbing and fascinating images from Luo Yang's internationally acclaimed series GIRLS (2007-2017), as seen on BBC, ARTE Journal or Huffington Post. 
Luo's GIRLS belong to a part of contemporary China that is rarely taken note of in the West. Her portraits depict an emerging Chinese subculture that defies imposed expectations and stereotypes: GIRLS are badassed and self-aware with a supreme sense of cool, yet also insecure, vulnerable and torn. Luo photographs the girls around her, attempting to grasp an understanding of their lives as well as her own. Although different, they share the same ambivalent emotions, confusions and concerns. It is in that connection that Luo finds the strength and fragility of her subject. 
“By shooting girls I understand their life better and it makes my own world bigger and wider. We might have different values and worldviews, but what we have in common are a fragility and braveness inside of us. We face the world with our sincerity.”  (Luo Yang)
Borne from this intuitive dialogue with her subjects, Luo’s images are bold and honest, intimate and sensitive at the same time. Her work explores the themes of youth and femininity, while challenging traditional beliefs about women in Chinese society. 
ABOUT US: LUO YANG & MO
Luo Yang, born 1984 in Liaoning Province in China's northeast, is a freelance photographer living and working in Beijing & Shanghai. One of the "rising stars of Chinese photography" (New Statesman, 2012), she has had numerous exhibitions in China and participated in major shows in Europe, amongst them Ai Weiwei’s “FUCK OFF 2” at the Groninger Museum, Netherlands, in 2013. Solo exhibitions in Berlin and Hong Kong have since contributed to her international recognition. In her work, highly staged portraits and carefully constructed poses alternate with a raw, blurred snapshot-aesthetic. She works with film cameras only, deliberately slowing down the creative process and focusing on a particular moment itself rather than on elaborating and refining an image in post-production.
MO-Industries is a POP-UP gallery staging cultural exchange between Asia and the West. It is a young venture that started at the end of 2015. Luo Yang and MO have been a team since the beginning of 2016, working closely on internationally showcasing Luo Yang's work, while scouting & introducing other exciting artists from China to the West (and vice versa).
Please support us in realising this beautiful project!
THE BOOK IN FACTS:
This compilation, published in a stunning silk-lined hardcover, is scheduled to be released by a renowned publishing house in Vienna in November 2017, reaching international bookstores in Spring 2018.  All texts are presented bilingually in English & Mandarin.

campaign.story:
Over the last few years the World of Anyaral has continued to grow and expand as I have inevitably got carried away sculpting new characters and races for the world. In order to share rules for the new units I periodically release a small digital magazine called 'The Twilight Traveller' or individual Playtest Scrolls. The time has come to pull together all the new releases from the last couple of years into a new Compiled Traveller! I will also be producing an accompanying deck of cards so you can start playing straight away.
The Traveller returns
  This issue of the Compiled Traveller will include lots of new units! The magazine has a general focus on the Engineers of Anyaral, otherwise known as 'Rahkiri'. These eccentric individuals have been a part of Twilight ever since I first started exploring the world so I think it's about time they got a bit more attention! 
At the moment the magazine is 24 pages long and includes rules for:
Belomoch dre Hearn and his explosive automata
Belan Rider
Toloran Cavalry
Nobleguard Crossbow
Imperial Standard
The Pree Pree!
Dhogu Archer and Yirnak Captain
Tak Sirahn
The Yartain and pups
Koi-Koi and Jakiin
 As with the other Twilight Kickstarters I have chosen a suitably eccentric Fubarnii to guide the way: Belomoch dre Hearne. Belomoch was created as part of a previous Kickstarter as a thank you for my friends, Ben and Louise Trayhorn. 
Belomoch dre Hearn and his automata
 As tends to be the case with these random creations, he's thoroughly made his home in Anyaral. He is an eccentric engineer from the coastal region of Teral who at an early age (after blowing up a local garkrid resin refinery) was sent to one of the colleges of Larigal. He has spent the following years causing plenty of trouble while experimenting with explosives and the interactions between living creatures and mechanical devices.
Belomoch is included in the Tinkerer pledge for an extra £6 over the Traveller but will normally sell for £9 so it's a great opportunity to add him to your collection!
For this campaign I'm keeping the pledge levels very simple! You can do the basic pledge for the Compiled Traveller and the cards for £10 or get Belomoch as well as the book and cards for £16.
The Traveller (£10): A printed copy of the Compiled Traveller 2 and the associated deck of 16 reference cards
The Tinkerer (£16): Belomoch Dre Hearne with two automata, a printed copy of the Compiled Traveller 2 and the associated deck of 16 reference cards
The Newcomer (£100): Everything you need to start playing
There is a small additional charge for postage.
Note that all models are supplied unpainted.
 If you would like to add anything to your pledge, then just increase the pledge by the necessary amount. There will be a pledge manager at the end of the campaign so you can tell me what exactly you would like!
                                          If this is the first you've heard of Twilight and Anyaral then you've got a whole world to explore! There is a lot of background on the World of Twilight page about the Fubarnii Empire, the Delgon, the Dhogu, the Devanu and the Casanii. You can also check out the previous Kickstarter pages (Travels through Anyaral and Casanii of Anyaral).
You can download the first edition of the rules here, as well as early issues of the Traveller, which give a good idea of what to expect!
Tak Sirahn and Yartain
  Mike Thorp (The Creator): Mike has done most of the work creating the world of Twilight. He first started sketching the Fubarnii and Devanu over 15 years ago and since then he has taught himself to sculpt, written and playtested the game and self-published three books in order to bring the world to life.   
Joe Karame (The Painter): Over the last few years Joe has been bringing the metal and resin sculpts to life with beautiful paintjobs. Joe runs his own miniature business, Joek Miniatures which has become increasingly focused on his fantastic sci-fi Odyssey universe.
Twilight Helpers (The Minions): There are countless people who have helped me get this project up and running. Particular thanks goes out to Vivek Chandra, Louise and Ben Trayhorn, Paul Townsend and of course my ever-tolerant family (Jules, Lexie and Emily).
Nobleguard of Gar Loren
  Those of you who follow on Facebook will have seen a few hints about the upcoming Kedashi releases... I'll be giving them some proper attention with a full release next year, but I wanted to publish rules for all the other models before getting completely distracted in the Naralon Forests!

Risks and challenges
Our experience on two previous projects and producing several books and magazines previously sets us in a good position to know what to expect with this small project.
The Traveller is largely written already so it is just a case of finishing the formatting, doing some more playtesting and getting it into print. The cards are following the standard design, so it's just the time consuming task of designing each of them!
The biggest risk is getting carried away with extra bits during the campaign, but the short timescale and targeted scope should make it easier to restrain myself!
